features: Electric water kettle with 1.0-liter capacity and 1500 watts of power for fast results (120V ~60Hz)
Cordless design allows for easy filling and serving; power base with 30-inch power cord for flexible placement, plus cord wrap for compact storage
Concealed heating element; BPA-free food-contact materials; removable filter for easy cleaning
Automatic shutoff with boil-dry protection for safety and peace of mind; water window for precise filling and checking levels at a glance
Backed by an AmazonBasics 1-year limited warranty

productInformation.Best Sellers Rank:
#46 in Kitchen & Dining (See Top 100 in Kitchen & Dining)
#1 in Electric Kettles

productDescription:
From the manufacturer
AmazonBasics Kitchen Collection
View larger
AmazonBasics Electric Kettle
Quickly boil up to 1 liter of water with the AmazonBasics Electric Kettle. The 1500-watt unit brings water to a rolling boil in a matter of minutes—no need for a slow stovetop or noisy microwave oven. Ideal for any kitchen, the cordless kettle conveniently boils water right on the countertop for use throughout the day—perfect for anything from coffee, tea, or hot cocoa to instant soup or noodles.
Easy to Clean
The electric kettle features a concealed heating element for a smooth, simple-to-clean interior, and all materials that come in contact with water are BPA-free. To further ensure great-tasting, healthier results, the kettle’s filter can be removed and cleaned as needed.
Details
1.0-liter cordless electric kettle
Auto shutoff with boil-dry protection
Base with 30-inch power cord
Easy-to-view water window
Concealed heating element
Backed by an AmazonBasics 1-year limited warranty
Auto Shutoff with Boil-Dry Protection
Turn the kettle on and walk away without having to worry. Once the water begins to boil, the kettle turns itself off automatically.
Cordless Convenience
Thanks to its convenient cordless design, the electric kettle lifts off its power base for easy filling at the sink and easy pouring without the hassle of a dangling power cord getting in the way.
User-Friendly Design
The kettle’s water window allows for precise filling and for checking water levels at a glance. Even more, the kettle’s power base provides a long 30-inch power cord for flexible placement on any counter. There’s also a handy cord wrap for keeping extra cord out of the way and for compact storage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for the office; starting to become unreliable
reviews.reviewText: This seemed like a great deal and I like the small size, which is good for a quick cup of tea or pourover at the office. After four months of regular use (about 2-3 times a day) it is starting to become unreliable. Getting it to turn on requires removing and re-seating the kettle a few times, and it sometimes turns off before the full cycle is finished.

used to be my favorite thing. now the ring around the central stainless base (if you look closely you see it\s not one piece) has rust spots on it. The opening with the lid makes it incredibly difficult to fit your hand in with some steel wool to scrub the stains off. i already tried for about 2 mins. i dont know if i have the patience. it\s really uncomfortable and awkward to stick your hand inside to scrub properly. "stainless" ... smh. i add photo later since many people show shiny photo.
"Water boiled in this definitely has a metallic taste.  Im returning it and ordering a better quality glass kettle."
Rust on the bottom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Value with a few limitations
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is great overall. We had a KitchenAid Pro Kettle die on us and we wanted something cheaper to replace it. For the price, this kettle is an excellent value. It takes approximately 4-5 minutes to boil a full kettle of water from room temperature., Pros: Quick boiling (4-5) minutes, Great value, Easy to use, Sturdy design, Easy to Clean, Cons: The body is not insulated so it gets very hot. Make sure to only grab the kettle by the handle., The lid does not open all the way when pressing the release button. I have to push the lid open further to be able to fill it under a faucet., No temperature adjustment

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed after the 5th. use. But did not ...
reviews.reviewText: Failed after the 5th. use. But did not pop up,result was all the water boiling out and the steam staining our cherry cabinets.  Stay faar away from this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: This kettle seems sturdy and boiled the full capacity of 1 liter of ...
reviews.reviewText: This kettle seems sturdy and boiled the full capacity of 1 liter of water for me in 5 minutes (to a roaring boil). Thought it would be faster but was satisfied with the speed compared to two other products the "Hamilton Beach 1.7L Stainless Steel Electric Kettle 40894" which boiled the same 1 liter literally 3 seconds faster but interesting this is that the Hamilton didn\t come to a roaring boil just got hot enough and turned off as most all electric kettles do.Second, i compared to is "Ovente KG83 Series 1.5L Glass Electric Kettle, Black" which took me 10 full minutes to boil 1.5 liters of water which is ridiculous so I didn\t even try with just 1 liter.
I received the product as scheduled. After using it once, it stopped working. I had to return it. What a waste of time!
Gets burning hot on the outside - I’ve had plenty of electric kettles and none had this issue. I returned it immediately.

Just received today (Thursday, 9/28/17) after ordering on September 25🙂. Cycled water through x 2 as per instruction after set up with no problems. A liter of water boiled fast in less than 3 minutes🙂. Only complaint  and the reason why I rated 4 stars is that the kettle gets extremely hot 🔥. It would have been much better if it was double walled stainless steel construction. Thinking about sending it right back and getting a more expensive double walled kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: After 8 months, rust beginning to form
reviews.reviewText: "We purchased this in May 2018 or right now, 8 months ago.  The AmazonBasics price was and still is amazing.  We knew we did not want plastic, which is typically at this price point.  The kettles view port for seeing the water is plastic, but thats the only piece that is plastic, outside of the lid and handle.  The operation of the kettle was straight forward and we loved how the boiling base remained behind and the kettle could be taken to the table.  The stainless was also pretty swanky looking and we appeared to have paid way more for something than we did.  It seemed we had fallen in love with our stainless steel beauty.", Like most relationships, nagging things began to show up.  It never left its wet towel on the floor or refused to put gas in the car, even when empty, but things cropped up., "Even when fully opened, the lid remains firmly in the way of an average adults hand trying to clean the inside.  When you do manage to get your hand and sponge or cloth inside, you are blindly wiping the interior.  Sometimes you feel like you did an amazing job, look inside, and realize you missed an entire area thats still foggy-looking while the rest of the stainless is sparkling.", The cord is approximately 24 inches, which is fine, but it has nowhere to go to when not in use.  So this length of cord is always introducing itself to other items on the shelf next to it.  Most times it likes to be a loner and no matter how hard we stuff it in, the cord pops out and dangles from the base\s perch.  You try to wrap it around the kettle, but at 24 inches, it is not long enough to get a good clinging wrap.  So it again pops out and dangles with a "How you doin\?" to the items below it on the shelf., These pale in comparison to watching the rust begin to form.  Clearly the direct visible bottom is stainless and the seam at its edges is not.  So now add the aggravation of trying to fit your hand in to clean and now trying to do something about the rust.  My photo is after me getting a good wipe for the photo.  The photo is looking down inside and the vertical post is where the handle exists.  Rust is forming at the seam and even where that post connects at the inside bottom., "For the price, this was a great little kettle.  We had no issues as other reviewers experienced.  It just worked.  It was used on average, once a day.  Wiped clean, the best we could.  And rust where the stainless ends and seam begins.  Can I say I got my moneys worth?  Yes.  I just never believed I was buying a 12 month disposable kettle."

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: "After researching the more expensive electric kettles and seeing all-around mixed reviews, I decided to go with this cheap model. The build quality is poor, but I figured that if it lasted a year, itd be worth it. Unfortunately, after a scant 16 days of use (2-3x per day), the automatic shutoff stopped working, and as there is no whistle, beep, or alarm to notify you when it has reached a rolling boil, it now needs to be babysat so it doesnt warp and melt the cheap plastic base. Overall, Im not impressed. Had I used it once a day, presumably it would have failed right outside the return window and Id be out $19.25. Instead, its going back to amazon and Ill be trying my luck with one of the high-end electric kettles."
Broke in a week. Seems that the electrical wiring burned itself out
Leaks from the first usage, returned this in 10 mts of arrival

reviews.reviewTitle: A really easy to use kettle that boils quickly and shuts itself ...
reviews.reviewText: A really easy to use kettle that boils quickly and shuts itself off when the water boils.  It has saved me the problem of worrying about whether I remembered to turn the stove off in the mornings when I leave for work.  My only caveat would be that it\s tempting to fill this to the top even though the "1.0 L" mark is about 3 inches from the lid - and if you do fill it to the top, you will inevitably spill as (1) the water will boil out of the spout, and (2) it\s impossible to pour from the spout without some leakage when it\s too full.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast,  hot,  clean,  easy to use-Love this kettle!
reviews.reviewText: "I love this kettle!  Ive had several different types of water heating appliances because I love tea.  I have tried microwaving,  traditional coffee pots, cheap plastic kettles,  and single serve pots.  I have 3 different locations for use: home,  school/office,  and camper.  This kettle had become a favorite  at all locations for its quick heat,  ear of use,  and temperature abilities.", In about 35 seconds, I have a liter of water at the perfect tea making  temp for black teas. For herbals,  I stop it a bit earlier for cooler brewing. My only improvements  would be to get the larger one for family at home and  I miss the programmable start time.  That second but is really laziness as the time it takes to get the mugs and tea ready is about how long it takes to heat width this unit., I will buy again.  The pot comes off the heating element for easy cleaning and safety.  I really love this thing at under $20 bucks.

Kettle was a nice introduction to this type of appliance--I was enjoying it--but after only eight uses--and I treated this item with a great deal of care (!)--the top door hinge, for no obvious reason, became "unhinged." (A piece of plastic broke off and fell into the water, causing the small bent-paper-clip-type hinge to pop out.) So I had to order another kettle (a different manufacturer--at least, ostensibly--though) this morning to replace this one. This kettle isn\t expensive, so it\s clearly not a huge financial burden to replace it, but what is the cost of landfills being filled with more and more planned obsolescence appliances?

reviews.reviewTitle: "Totally solid kettle for the price, but for regular use, Id spring for a nicer Bodum one"
reviews.reviewText: Totally solid kettle for the price.  I got it to use temporarily on a very long work trip and it was fine, but for home use, I prefer my more expensive, but more practical Bodum kettle.  The key differences:, "- The AmazonBasics kettles minimum fill line is too much water for one cup", - As a result of requiring more water, it boils slower, - Overall capacity is small, - Power cord is short, "- Kettle is noisy when heating, but the click when its ready is too quiet", That said, using this kettle is much faster than a stovetop kettle and better than a microwave by far.

We really like this kettle. It was a replacement for our Sunbeam Hot Shot which we thought we could never live without. But the reviews were not good on that product anymore so we purchased this. We like this pot a lot! It takes up only a small space on the counter and heats the water up very fast. The 2 foot cord wraps in a coil and his hidden in the bottom so you pull out only the length you need -- no long cords on the counter-top anymore. It is lightweight and pours easily with no spilling or dripping. It also looks very handsome and appears to be more expensive than it is. This is a very good buy.

Fantastic kettle! I didn’t have high hopes for this kettle, but it was only $16, so I thought I’d give it a try. Yes, as others have noted, it is quite loud. However, it heats up extremely quickly! It is 1500 Watts, compared to most others that are 1000 to 1200 Watts. In fact, it took 4 minutes, on the dot, to boil 1000ml. The other issue I have is that the button to start is a little funky. Oddly, the kettle has to be in a certain position on the base for the lever to stay down. All that to say, though, I would recommend this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Brand new but beats my early expectations
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for use in a facility where a family member is recuperating. Figured it would save me trips to the coffee shop and pay for itself - rapidly. So far - I’d rate it better than expected. The water boils super fast and when I say HOT - I mean hot. The unit will auto shut off upon reaching the boil and it’s easily seen and heard. Unit is pretty noisy when boiling but that’s a minor issue because it’s really quick. I’ve made tea coffee cocoa and they’re all great steeping fully and without that white foam that appears when water temps are less than ideal.the appearance is clean and simple reminiscent of an old fashioned retro coffee percolator without the perk top. Handle is comfortable and capacity yields plenty. It’s brand new so we will see how it lasts but for the price I’d say once again amazon basics has “delivered the goods”. Loving it!

DO NOT BUY!!!  This pot just did a meltdown.  Fire department had to be called to get the smoke out of the house.  Fire department agreed the pot malfunction.  Purchased February 2019.  Burned up May 2019!

I just received this and the base didn’t sit flush the the teapot. It wobbles and doesn’t feel very stable. I was hoping once I turned the kettle on there would be a locking mechanism but no such luck. Bummed this wasn’t better quality

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice though smaller than I expected
reviews.reviewText: "Its smaller than I expected. My fault as I should have realized this based on the clearly stated 1 liter capacity.  Pictured next to our old Breville SK500XL which Id repaired (new contacts in base etc) several times before it finally died.  The smaller size of the Amazon probably saves money,  no more boiling too much water and it takes up less space on kitchen counter.  Ive didnt experience any odors on first use, Ill update review if we get corrosion."

I think this is a great little kettle. I drink tea nonstop. I mean what do you need? I need a kettle to boil the hell out of some water fast. I don’t need it to filter clean water, boiling does that. It wasn’t expensive, it’s all stainless for the exception of a few plastic parts (handle, window, base), and it seems well made. It automatically shuts off. Seems to take about 2-3 minutes to heat up, and stays hot since stainless retains heat. For $20 I’m super happy. I didn’t rate 5 stars only because I’ve had it about a week. If it lasts 2 yrs it’s well worth the money.  I upped my review to 5 stars.  I just love this thing.

Pleasantly surprised with how well this works!, I was nervous about buying an electric kettle for such a low price when other products seemed to be in a higher price range. I tried this just because it was Amazons choice and it didn’t dissapoint. It’s quick & quiet although pretty basic with only one button. Once it’s done, it auto shuts off so that the water stops boiling. I would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for an electric kettle!

Strong and unbearable metallic taste which my other steel kettle don’t have. I already threw the package box so I couldn’t return it anymore. Hopefully the taste will fade away eventually, which hasn’t happen after a month anyway. But I strongly suggest people don’t buy this item or at least keep you package box just to in case.

Great kettle and oh so cheap!!! This kettle is easy to use, very cheap, and very good. I have been using it for about 2 months and it still works like the first time. Has clear indicators for the amount of water you are filling. Gets boiling hot in about 1 minute. The automatic off switch is perfect for mornings so you can do other things while the water boils. Make sure you empty all the remaining water out of the kettle and leave the lid open to let all the steam exit to avoid corrosion or anything. Love this little thing.

"The product is good but the calcium deposits are annoying! The grooves at the bottom make it hard to clean in the cracks. The product does what it says, boils water very quickly! I love the fact of that, but if youre a clean freak like me, youll hate the calcium leftovers.", Make sure you use clean, filtered water for each boil. If you are lazy and use regular tap or fountain water, boil some vinegar here and there to remove the white build up at the bottom., "At first I didnt notice it but when you see white flakes in the tank, you cringe in disgust a little bit."

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use. Beats stovetop heat.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Do not wash with soap and water after opening. I almost did but stopped with the water running because I didn’t think I should get the electronic base wet. Thank goodness I stopped to read the instructions. All you need to do is boil water in the kettle twice, replacing the water the second time. Then it’s clean! The water heats up super fast. Easy to use. The base doesn’t get the counter hot. Really beats boiling the water in my old teakettle and sweating with the stove’s heat. I love this kettle. The inside bottom is cool too. It’s a very clear mirror.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value for the money, but lacks features
reviews.reviewText: Pros:, * Price, * Footprint, * Boils very fast, * Water level window, so you boil just enough, Cons:, * Needs 2-3 boils first, one with vinegar before using, otherwise water has metallic taste., "* Lid isnt spring loaded, doesnt return to closed position on its own.", * No "ready" buzzer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unsafe: outside becomes steaming hot to the touch
reviews.reviewText: This works well but I’m giving it a 1 because the outside becomes searing hot when you hear water., Too bad. I got this instead of the Bodum brand. Will now order the latter which has an insulated pot. This isn’t 1975 for crying out loud, no reason this pot shouldn’t be insulated and SAFE

Pro—this water kettle works. The water will get hot., Cons—relatively poor quality, and your heated water will come in contact with heated plastic (albeit listed as BPA free). The transparent water level window is made of plastic, as is the ‘filter’ at the spout which is very cheap plastic. It immediately broke when I tried to remove it (following the instructions for removal). I didn’t care because it is very low quality plastic and didn’t want it coming into contact with my water anyway., Unfortunately I don’t return Amazon purchases so I’m stuck with this product which I’m not too thrilled about. Plan to use it for a few weeks/months until I can upgrade (I imagine almost anything will be an upgrade). Chalk one in the minus column for ‘AmazonBasics’.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ehh, I mean, it boils water
reviews.reviewText: "It boils water. The lid snapped off, but I can put it back on if I feel like getting my hands exfoliated by 220 degree steam, which happens quite often. Im not sure why Im given an opportunity to rate the safety features, but Im sure if you do something stupid like put hydrochloric acid in it, it will shut off when it explodes, which is a safety feature if you think about it. Also, I get free electricity at my college so I cant comment on energy efficiency, but if youre boiling so much water in this that you notice it in your monthly electricity bill I feel like you need to make some lifestyle changes before you write a review about how inefficient this kettle is.", "But its cheap, so Ill overlook it. Just dont bend the lid or do anything with it because the pieces are plastic and theyll snap quicker than public opinion changed about Michael Jackson.", I should really probably study for my test.
The inner part of the lid is plastic, such that the boiled water reeked of plastic., However, Amazon helped out with a refund

"What a waste. My office mate and I wanted a kettle for our space but didnt want to spend a fortune. We made the mistake of trusting star ratings and Amazons name. This product arrived in good time, but when I unwrapped it, the cord was not even long enough to allow it to be plugged into the wall and sit on the table right above it. We decided that we would just have to invest in an extension cord, and when we tested it, the kettle boiled one pot, and it has not worked since. Honestly, spend a little more and dont bother with this inferior product."
Cheap quality, mine ended up literally coming apart, some of the interior white plastic started sloughing off into my hot water in 1 week!

"We recently decided to invest in a french press for making coffee and needed a tea kettle to heat up the water.  I have the old stovetop tea kettles, but I dont like those as much.  After being overseas and seeing that everyone uses an electric kettle, I decided to purchase one too.  This is very easy to use and Im amazed at how quickly it heats up water. The water stays hot for quite a while too. My daughter loved it so much when she came to visit that we bought her one too!"

I bought it coz its easy to clean. but there is plastic parts inside especially the lid. not sure its BPA Free. coz you know that is where all the steam gets and there is a good chance of the plastic residues in the water as steam is hotter than the water. They failed to put steel in the right spot. you get what you pay for. I am keeping it though coz mine is a temporary use.
Worked great at first but already crapped out. Probably only used it 30 times. Not very happy with this purchase. I do not recommend this product.

I was extremely disappointed with this item. It heated the water very fast which was great but the entire kettle, minus the handle was so insanely hot! As long as you make sure you ONLY touch the handle and have no little ones near by that may accidentally touch the kettle you will be in good shape. I had to warn everyone that went to pick it up and some people still burnt their hand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute little kettle of good quality steel
reviews.reviewText: Cute little kettle of good quality steel. Warms water pretty quickly. Cons: It warms up the surface as well, not double walled, can be a hazard if within reach of a kid. It makes loud noise while boiling water but only stays for a minute or so, so not that big of a problem for me. Overall nice, cheap steel kettle that works!

"Have had this for just a few weeks.  It heats up fast BUT, the inside bottom is already getting pitted.  I drain it after use, but the inside bottom metal piece is showing signs of deterioration.  Dont expect it to be durable in the long run. I would return it  but I threw out the box. I usually keep  the packaging for a long time but I did not expect  to have a problem.  Oh well."

Have had a lot of tea kettles and non have lasted.  This is refreshingly basic:  It brings water to a boil and then shuts off.  No bells, whistles, flashing lights, temperature settings, nor does it hold the temp.  The pot is not insulated and it gets hot but no problem if you keep your hands off of it.  Like most of the other pots, the top does not open wide enough to get your hand in it to scrub it out, and, like all the others, the top hinge is not real beefy but should be fine if handled according ly., We love the simplicity and lack of annoying beeps, dings or other noises., Big question now is "will it last?"  Non of the others have lasted more than 12 months with one exception which lasted a short time longer., We are retired and drink a lot of green tea so this is used repeatedly each day.

This water heater has no internal shut-off. The only way it shuts off automatically is if the switch has clearance to move upward. During normal operation this switch was caught under a protrusion of my toaster-oven, which prevented automatic shut off, and a liter of water nearly boiled away in a matter of minutes., "I think selling this unit is incredibly negligent on Amazons part, but Ill still use it. I just keep it unplugged and stored in a box when its not actively being used because Im understandably anxious its going to set my house on fire."

reviews.reviewTitle: First one was faulty, this one works great
reviews.reviewText: First all, I have had several electric kettles in my life, and have decided against the plastic kind with the metal wand inside that warm the water. Those build up all types of gunk, and the plastic smells some times., THIS amazon basics one was hgih on my list because of 1. cost, 2. look 3. size ( i did not need something very large)., I have 6 (thats right SIX) coworkers that all this same one, and when I got mine I asked them about the droplets of water coming out from the "window"(where you see how much water is inside). They all looked at me like i was crazy, and turned out mine was defective. Had amazon send a new one (super easy), and this one doesn\t leak at all., "Importantly, I have been using it for about a month. Size is good, release lever is good. Doesnt spill when you poor. Cord is about 3 feet (no matter which kettle you choose, you will almost always need an extension for an office desk). Handle is far enough away from kettle to not burn you.", Overall great purchase. I have a black and decker at home, and this is better.
Second time I have bought this. Electric part went out after about 10 uses on first and this one burnt out on second use.
I have had the water boiler for 3-4 weeks. The lid broke, and it is no longer possible to take it off. Terrible quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value, but cord is too short
reviews.reviewText: After several weeks of testing I am giving this electric kettle 4 stars. This works well for two of us but for a larger family I would recommend a larger size.  Heats water fast, like 3.5 minutes fast. I bought it after using one at a vacation rental. Much safer than boiling water on a stove as it will automatically shut off once the water hits the boiling point. The only reason I gave it less than 5 stars is because of the short electric cord that limited where on my counter top I could put it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value and very good product overall!
reviews.reviewText: "Such a good value! Perfect size for our needs. Really really fast at 1500W! And safe, as it automatically turns off (dont ask why we needed to replace our old stovetop kettle!)", If I HAD to gripe:, * My thumb sometimes goes over the handle and touches the hot chassis by the lid., * The water level indicator is awkward to look at if you hold it with your left hand as you fill it., "* The lid doesnt open very far, makes it weird to clean.", * It kind of rocks around on the base., "* Its a lot louder than our old gas range kettle.", Even so, five stars, and at such a good price! I would be happy to give this as a gift or buy it again if I needed to.

This kettle hits the sweet spot in the categories of value, size, functionality and appearance. It holds 1 liter, which is a little less than a quart. Its the perfect size for heating water quickly for one to three cups of tea. The on/off button lights up when on. The auto shut off is an important safety feature. The lid opens up to about 3/4 to fully open. I would like it to open fully, but this has not been an issue for either filling or cleaning. Love this kettle and would recommend it.

I bought this kettle in Nov 2018 to use in my office. It is now March 2019 and the rim (see photo) has already rusted! It is a very strange place to rust because that has the least amount of contact with water. I am not happy at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wasn’t expecting to love this kettle so much
reviews.reviewText: We read through probably every single electric kettle review blog before buying this one. I actually hadn’t read the reviews before doing so...and I’m glad because they definitely would’ve scared me off. I’ve had this kettle for, over a month now (boiled dozens upon dozens of cups of water for tea) and have had no issues. A smattering of discoloration on the bottom but nothing major. Everything works as it should, but will update if things go south., " I originally wanted one with temperature control since were big tea drinkers in our house but either 1) they were too expensive or 2) I didn’t like the look of them. I love the retro-ish look of the steel and it’s smaller than I had expected - which makes me love it even more!", I find that filling up to the second mark makes exactly enough for two cups of tea. I timed it and it took about 3 minutes for the water to boil. The handle is cool to the touch and the one time I touched the body of the kettle (I wasn’t sure if I had boiled the water already or not) it wasn’t hot enough to burn me., TLDR: awesome little kettle - affordable, gets water hot, and looks nice on my kitchen counter

reviews.reviewTitle: Faster than a microwave! Wonderful product
reviews.reviewText: Folks I did not time this but I am pretty sure this thing heats up water to boiling point faster than a microwave. No explosion with water spilling everywhere if you heat too long or having to re-start if you did not get timing right., From room temperature to boiling in about a minute and less if it is not full. It will stop heating the water automatically and switch off once the water reaches the boiling point. I end up helping my coffee maker with this kettle. Fast , Handy and safe. I wish I had though of this first., Real coffee drinker don;t spike the brew with that white liquid or poison(sugar) So it is gets bitter, turn this kettle on and in a bout a minute or less your coffee is hot and fresh  again.

Allow me to get this out of the way. If you are looking for a perfect stainless steel kettle, this is not it. Your water will come into contact with plastic., I, nor the person I gifted this kettle to, cares about that. This was a Christmas gift for my significant other. She loves tea and I thought this would be good for her to take to work with her so that she could have a hot cup of tea to calm her nerves whenever she needed., It works like a charm., It holds 1 liter of water which is good for about 3~4 cups of tea before a refill. It has a simple on/off switch, but also will turn off automatically when your water comes to a rolling boil. It heats significantly faster than I expected from such a budget friendly kettle. A full liter of fresh cold water will be boiling in roughly 5 minutes. In spite of having plastic parts, the unit feels like it is constructed well and I expect longevity from it., "The only feature this kettle omits is a temperature gauge. If you dont need it, then this kettle will perform to expectation.", It even surpassed expectations for me. Highly recommended.

Owned 1 mo. Love this kettle! My husband and I make tea throughout the day, and this is enough for two large cups without being overly large (so it is energy efficient). No problems with auto shutoff turning back on as some reviews said. No plastic smell or taste to water from the little plastic pieces on the lid. No rust, and we leave water sitting in it between boils and top off when we want a cup. It isn’t fancy... it’s what it says: “basic”. But it looks nice and does what it needs to: boils water (fast)., Only drawback... if we drink our first cup too fast and need to refill it quickly, the lid is too hot to touch...and you must touch the lid... it only opens 3/4 of the way with the spring release button, so you have to pull the lid back to fill without spilling. But we chose a smaller model for energy efficiency, so that’s on us. We pop the top and the lid cools off after a minute.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect considering what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: I bought an electric water kettle and it does the job: heat the water! It is quick, and super easy to use (like any other electric kettle I have ever seen). However, the low price shows a little in a few details: first, the outside of the kettle gets hot, so you have to make sure to use the handle without touching the metal (but it doesn\t get too hot; like, it hurts a bit but no burns or anything). Then, the lid doesn\t open completely, which makes filling it a little annoying sometimes. But these two "problems" are really nothing, just minor inconveniences considering the low price of the kettle. I don\t regret the buy one bit.

"Weve had this for a few weeks and it works great.  It holds enough water for my hubby and I to both have a cup.  It heats up in just a few minutes (maybe 3) and I love the automatic shut off!  It is a bit loud when its working, but thats how I realize when its done heating up my water.  So far, so good!"

"I purchased this product to replace another small electric kettle that my Grandmother had that was unable to be cleaned due to scaling on the bottom from hard water.  This is perfect for her! it is small, perfect for one person, and very lightweight. These are essential components for her as she lives alone and has severe arthritis in her shoulders, so pouring a large or heavy kettle is impossible for her. She is NOT skilled at using complicated electronics (because she chooses not to be....the most stubborn 85 year old woman I have ever known...), and this is simple to use AND has a great automatic off feature, so we dont worry about her burning the house down. She uses the kettle every day to make herself tea and instant coffee, and it is working great! Due to size and weight, this product is perfect for elderly people, people who live alone, and even college dorms!  Definitely recommend."

"I needed a kettle quickly for a party I was hosting and this ended up being perfect! I honestly only really chose this one because it was cheaper and I just needed it for 1 event, but I have ended up using it multiple times in the last month or 2 of owning it! Every time I use it for gatherings, people are asking me where I got it and saying they want one. Its really simple to use, easy to clean out, and heats water up pretty quickly. Its not huge, so Ive had to make a couple batches of water with larger gatherings, but because it heats up so quickly, it hasnt been a big deal at all!! Faster than microwaving several mugs of water would be. It does get extremely hot so if you dont want that, youd have to watch it and stop it before it gets to boiling. Overall, its a great product and I highly recommend!"

I got this kettle for traveling. My partner and I are coffee snobs so we bring everything we need to fresh-grind our coffee and prepare it in a french press in hotel and B&B rooms. I love that the kettle effortlessly separates from the electric burner for refilling and pouring: this means it has lower "head room" so when filling, it can fit under the spout of a bathroom sink; no worries about getting electrical parts wet; the burner only turns on when the kettle is seated in place, so no worries about forgetting to turn it off; and the electric wire coils neatly under the base when not in use. The only "control" is a lever to turn it on. A liter of water boils very quickly and it turns off automatically once the water boils.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price, heats fast, seems well made
reviews.reviewText: "I decided that having a Keurig on my boat boat took up a lot of counter space for something that wasnt used that often. Space on a boat is always a premium. So I decided to go with an electric kettle and manual coffee pod coffee maker (Presto MyCup). This allows me to not only make coffee when I want, but tea, soup, etc., without having to wait on the microwave or use the cooktop. This works really well and is nice and small for storage in a cabinet. Very happy with it and seems well made. I timed it and it heated 1L of water from start to the pot turning off on its own in 4min 21 seconds. It has enough water to make 3 large cups of coffee too (10-12 oz each). The cord storage in the base is a nice touch too. Great buy for the price."

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I wait so long to get this?
reviews.reviewText: This is by far the best investment of kitchen item that I ever made! It heats the water up much more efficiently that my regular kettle. I use it for my coffee and mostly. I use a Chemex to make my coffee and this is really easy to pour over the grounds., This is also fantastic to use for heating up water for oatmeal or other items where you would have usually heated it up in a pot. I love using it for instant mashed potatoes too! The only negative I have for this is on me. I should have looked for a bigger one. I use this so much throughout the day, I am constantly refilling it. I would definitely recommend a hundred times over!

Initially this worked great. Heats and boils water crazy fast for my tea every morning. Less than a month of using it I noticed shiny, flaky, metal material floating around in my water when I pour it into my mug. Upon closer look the bottom of the kettle (see image attached) had started flaking and falling apart, and those flakes end up in your water... kinda gross. I still use the kettle and pour the water through a strainer when I pour it into my mug. it was inexpensive, but still disappointing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Keeps up with heavy use, so far
reviews.reviewText: My favorite and most used kitchen appliance., "Heats quickly, has an auto shutoff once it reaches temp, and doesnt take up my entire countertop. I really like that I can take the pot off its base andaround the kitchen without having to drag a cord with me or needing a hot glove. I daily heat multiple pots of water for pourover or frech press coffee, miso soup, oatmeal, rice noodles, tea, starting a pot for boiling, hot cleaning water, etc, etc, etc. It has worked like a champ so far. My last electric kettle (built in the 1980, bought from the thriftshop in 2010) lasted for 8+ years, yes it still works, so hopefully this will last just as long."

"This is a great little pot for heating water for my pour-over coffee maker. In fact, we use it to boil water for everything... to get the water hot fast, then transfer the water to a container on the stove, on a burner... that is how fast it boils water.  Only draw back is that you must, (naturally and logically) use RO water (reverse osmosis) that has no mineral deposits in it (or use bottled water).  Every electric kettle will have a build up of mineral deposits in the bottom. This one is tough to clean that out, if it bugs you, if you have large hands.... but really, just use RO water and you will have zero issues.  I just saw this same unit for sale at Home Depot over Christmas for $29!.... What?  So, at $16 or $18 dollars, its a good deal... 5 stars on this."

"I purchased one of these, loved it.  Heats water up fast, clean taste, small and convenient and affordable.  Great purchase.  Then I was looking for another one for work and thought I would take this one to work and get another one for home.  I wanted one with a bit larger volume and thought Id get one with the amazing glass and blue light, but really was looking for a larger volume and no plastics.  This model has a little plastic and I thought, maybe at some point this is bad, and I bought the hype of the other brands touting their fancy glass container and no plastics.  Well, when I got the new heater and heated my water it had a weird, burnt metallic taste which is not there with the Amazons Basic kettle.  The amazons basic kettle has a clean taste and heated faster.  So in the end, I opted for a product that didnt change the taste of my water and heated quicker.  My stovetop kettle took about the same time or less than the other kettle I had bought. So, I sent the foul tasting kettle back (I think the metal they use with the heating element has something to do with it) and picked up another one  of Amazons basic kettle.  Love it."

"Im on a path to reduce my carbon footprint, and reduce the amount of plastic in my life.  I get that electric kettles are more efficient than the tea kettle on the stove.  But I was pleasantly surprised to find almost no plastic in the packing material.  Just a plastic sleeve to protect the finish.  That could probably be replaced with paper.  The rest was pure cardboard.  Thank you.  Oh- why did I not give it 5 stars?  It is obviously a right-handed tool.  Fortunately Im right handed.  If you move the sight glass to the handle, and get rid of the plastic sleeve, this would rate 5 very shiny stars."

"I got this little gem to replace an old plastic one that had a short thick cord that had to be unplugged every time I Wanted to empty or fill it. It still worked, it was just too annoying to deal with several times a day. This one looks nice with its sleek stainless steel design and is super easy to clean, fill and empty since the heating element is separate and stays in place on the counter.  The cord stays neatly wrapped up and out of the way. All around a nifty kitchen addition."

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! Love it! Love it!
reviews.reviewText: "Yes, Im absent minded and ruined two pots because I left them on the stove long after the water boiled away. Had to throw them out. This electric pot heats up quickly and in just about 3 minutes I have boiling water. If I forget that I turned it on and come back. It is off.  It stays hot for quite some time as well. With its one-button touch feature I can easily heat the water up again. I also like that it sits on a plate that has the heating element and the cord. This allows me to remove the pot and move around freely with it. No cords to trip over or cause any accidents. Great for those of us who are easily distracted. Love it."

This kettle is visually appealing, but the outside gets VERY hot when contents are heated., "Ive let it reach boiling point twice now and with only .75 l water, boiling hot water comes shooting out the spout, burning and soaking everything nearby. THEN it switches off.", Water does get hot, so one star. The other star for being cordless., Not very safe and kind of scary otherwise...

"I only make one (large) cup at a time so I didnt need a large capacity kettle. This does not take up much counterspace.  Heats faster than a stove top kettle. Not particularly noisy, no metallic taste, hot exterior hasnt been a problem.", "The only quibble I have is when it clicks off after boiling, the sound is not very loud if you are in another room (thats why I get automatic off kettles, so I dont have to hang around waiting for them to boil).", "Ive only had it for a week. Well see if it lasts longer than my previous cheapo one (different brand) which stopped working after a total of 12 months of use."

In reality, these hot pots last forever!  I had one that I had for years, so long in fact that the white plastic was really discolored.  My daughter kept telling me to "throw that ugly thing away Mom!"  Well, I couldn\t because it still worked.  When I packed for my move, my daughter tossed it out so I had to buy a new one.  I\m so glad she did that because now I got a nice shiny new hot pot and it goes nicely in my nice new kitchen!!  I don\t think this one can discolor due to the fact that its silver so I think it\s safe for years to come!

reviews.reviewTitle: Attractive and efficient, perfect if minor improvements
reviews.reviewText: I’ve always been a holdout for the old fashioned whistle kettle on the stove but they’re so inconvenient and prone to accidents. So I stepped out of my comfort zone and tried this little electric kettle because it wasn’t so expensive I would be angry if I ended up hating it. I love it!  It looks good and it heats water fast fast fast. Boiling hot too and I was worried on that point. If I had to make a suggestion, the cord placement is a little awkward and the FULL line isn’t easy to see. I had to mark it with a sharpie. They could easily just make a black plastic pip there. But it’s a small thing easily resolved and younger eyes might not even need it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This little kettle is great for me.
reviews.reviewText: I have used this little guy for 9 months and I love it.  I bought it to replace a $200.00 kettle which broke after 6 mo., In frustration I purchased this inexpensive, basic kettle., "Heres what i really like:", "1. It is safe.  Even when full I dont need to use two hands to pour a cup and it has automatic shut off.", 2. It works.  Every time i need a cup of tea, it fires right up and quickly heats water., "3. Efficiency.  I dont waste time / energy heating too much water.  I never make a pot of tea, just cups.", 4. It is small.  It takes up no space on my kitchen counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: "You wouldnt want to drink water boiled in this kettle!"
reviews.reviewText: "First of all, it is loud af. But the worst part is that weird residue come from the bottom of the container every time after I boil water in it. I have boiled water for 6,7 times now and there is still a layer of stuff on the surface of the water. When I tried to rub the bottom of the kettle with my fingers, some white stuff sticks to my fingers. And the removable filter is difficult to remove! I dont dare drink that water, idk what is in it! This product simply fails at its purpose. I dont recommend it."

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for super fast hot water
reviews.reviewText: Using this kettle is so much faster than stove top. I can get hot water in about 3-5 minutes, and the kettle holds enough water to make 2 regular size travel mugs of tea. I use it all the time and make more tea than I ever had before., For people with rust issues, make sure to pop open the top after using the hot water otherwise a lot of condensation can build on the inside due to the small spout being the only other air escape. The condensation can sit around for days, which can easily cause rust on any "stainless" metal cut edges.

reviews.reviewTitle: A reasonable investment for a favorite appliance
reviews.reviewText: "We use an electric kettle like this a lot, and I mean a lot, being avid tea drinkers. The problem is that they burn out or the switches go south too fast. Weve tried several brands and only one from Germany lasted more than 12-18 months. So, when the latest one went wobbly, we got this one. A little smaller than others, it takes up less space on the counter, which is nice. Its very attractive, and we will see how long it lasts. But --- even if it goes after the warranty expires, the price for replacement is not prohibitive."

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, as long as you are careful
reviews.reviewText: "This is a good small electric kettle, perfect for a single person or a couple. If you have children or elderly people at home, however, BUY SOMETHING SAFER. The exterior of the kettle gets very hot: if you forget to touch only the handle, you will burn your hands. And if you dont empty it after boiling water, the kettle can stay as hot as an iron for over ten minutes. For the same reason, I always put it on an uncluttered surface, away from anything else."

This steel electric kettle is smaller than what I expected. For the first time I used it, I can smell strong steel taste and I think because it’s new, maybe I use for few time this taste will go away; but after I used it for one week and the steel taste still stay. Finally, I am so disappointed for this product。

reviews.reviewTitle: After just a few months, the button to open the lid has stopped working
reviews.reviewText: "This was a decent little tea kettle at first blush. It doesnt take up very much counter space, it heats the water fairly quickly, it has a decent capacity...", But it was brought to my attention after I bought it that it has a fair amount of plastic exposed to the steaming water, which is really unhealthy., "Most disappointing, the button on the handle that pops open the lid has stopped working properly, just a few months after having bought it. I guess you get what you pay for. Im pretty sure this thing was less than 20 bucks."

reviews.reviewTitle: I BOUGHT MORE AS GIFTS AFTER USING IT!!
reviews.reviewText: I\d never even HEARD of electric teakettles until a recent trip to California; every AirB&B we stayed in had one!  So I looked them over and bought this best seller, and I\ll tell you what I love about it.  It heats water up really fast, much faster than waiting for a teakettle on the stove.  It has an automatic shutoff, so it\s perfect both for my 93-year old MIL AND my daughter who\s sleep deprived w/a newborn!  No worries about either of them burning the house down.  The switch is super easy for arthritic fingers to push, and since the cord is attached to the base and not the kettle part, you don\t have to pull an annoying cord out of the way. My husband wishes it made a sound when it\s ready, but it\s so fast, if you turn it on,  get your tea bag and cup ready, it\s about done, so I don\t see the lack of a "ding" as a problem.  My 3 adult kids all want one now.  I don\t like ice water, so I am actually drinking a lot more now that this makes boiling water so quick and easy.  Tea or hot chocolate are soothing, so to get hot drinks so quickly and easily is a win-win.  I don\t like heating water in the microwave; I don\t want to burn myself on a hot cup handle, etc.  This is a great little product!

"This thing is great. Heats up super fast and keeps water hot for a long time even after it shuts off. The auto shut off is a nice feature, so theres no worry about it boiling over or boiling dry. The only downside is that the kettle gets very hot, so you need to be careful not to touch it while its going or well after, but the same can be said about a stovetop kettle."

reviews.reviewTitle: "Excellent product. Does exact what its supposed to."
reviews.reviewText: "I gave this to my roommate as a gift because she would frequently boil water in a small pot (and then forget about it).  I bought this in an effort to avoid burning the house down.  She LOVES it and has been using it 2-3 times a day ever since.  Im very impressed by the quality and ease of use and could not be more pleased."

I bought it for its great review on Amazon and didn’t pay attention that it max boils 1 liter water. My issue with this is, I feel it boils very slow for only 1 liter. Should be faster. I need a 1.7 liter kettle since we are a big family. Have to get another bigger one, otherwise it will take forever to boil. But since it is my fault didn’t read instruction clearly I’ll keep the kettle. However please remember this item is also not return for free, need to pay 6 bucks if you return it. Also I don’t like the plastic part to show you the water level, don’t feel very safe when you boil hot water with a piece of plastic inside.

Received the kettle and it looks great.  Cleaned it then used it and it worked awesome once.  The second time I used it, it leaked a bit of water from the base and I just thought I had spilled it.  I just wiped it off and thought nothing of it.  The third time I used it there was more water than I felt comfortable with to use it again as it was leaking around the electrical connection.  I would not recommend this kettle.

"This kettle works fast, is nice and small but had a plastic piece inside that smells.  Too late to return.  im worried about BPA and the plastic getting so hot.  The inside has a plastic odor and ive used it alot"

"Despite its simplicity, this kettle has proved quite versatile and I am quite happy I decided to invest in an electric kettle and learn how to use one beyond the obvious tea and coffee and anything that can be cooked by simply pouring boiling water over it and letting it sit when my familys microwave died a few months back. In addition to being able to brew myself a hot cuppa, I can now boil my own eggs, cook my own rice, make dried beans edible, and kettle cooked oatmeal and potatoes are on my list of things to try.", Pros:, -Large, insulated handle. Easy to grip even with my massive hands and sticks out far enough that I can sit the kettle on the edge of my counter with the handle facing outward and then easily scan the edge of the counter top to locate the handle without risk of burning my hand or knocking it off the counter, a vitally important safety feature to the independant blind person., -Easy to fill and just the right size for making kettle cooked meals for one person., -Retains heat well when left close and full of hot water, but cools quickly once empty and nearly instantly if refilled with cold water., -The cord is neither frustratingly long or frustratingly short., -No annoyingly high-pitched beeps., Cons:, -Outer shell gets hot enough to burn., -Opening is a bit narrow for pouring canned goods and makes pouring from a measuring cup a bit tricky. I intend to buy a funnel to address this issue., -It\s tall, narrow body shape makes stirring contents without being burned by steam difficult. I\ve ordered some 12" glass stirring rods to address this issue., "-Its too quiet when the water isnt boiling. Nothing to indicate its working for the first minute or two, and the click when it shuts off cant be heard if you arent standing next to it.", "-Adding granular food stuff to a cold kettle seems to confuse what ever detects it should shut off, making it useless for heating canned vegetables unless theyre added to something that requires adding water(Pouring boiling water over  a bowl of dry ramen topped with canned beans works great, but in addition to the trouble of pouring canned beans into the opening, best I can tell, Id have to hold down the switch for it to stay on long enough to heat the canned beans. This issue doesnt seem to extend to say, adding dried beans or rice to already heated water and reheating to a boil.", "-Dried beans have a tendency to get stuck between the wall and a mounted on the inside of the kettle and in the corners of the viewing window. Rice just stickes to everything. Also, even with the filter removed, the spout wont allow for pouring rice or beans out, and dumping them by inverting and opening the lead, the lip catches a lot. Refilling with cold water and using my hand to scrape the inside of the kettle makes removing the stubborn food easy enough, but its still annoying and I cant help thinking it shouldnt be this hard. Gives me pause regarding trying kettle cooked oatmeal(heres hoping pour over works even for non-instant oats).", "The cord doesnt fully retract into the base.", -Water sometimes leaks on to the counter top., "Overall, it could be better, but for being one of the cheapest kettles out there, its surprisingly good."

It is great product to heat up water quick and keeps it warm. Very handy for hot tea., Just in 5 months of use, noticed rust inside at bottom. Did not expected a stainless steel item to rust., Talked to Amazon and they were prompt to send a replacement as it was still under warranty. Only they wanted the previous item back - which I almost threw

Affordable and works perfectly. No complaints whatsoever. Great unit., "<edit 7/12/19>The other feature that I forgot to mention and that I LOVE is the push button to open the top of the unit to fill.  For someone w/arthritis in their hands, this is a godsend.  I dont remember when I purchased this.  I still think it is a great unit for the price.  Seems perhaps to be taking a bit longer to boil but certainly not a big deal.  Good job, Amazon. :)"

reviews.reviewTitle: Super fast and great safety features
reviews.reviewText: This product is awesome. I bought it for my French press. I didn’t bother reading the instructions but was pleasantly surprised that the unit automatically shuts off when it hits boiling point, a safety feature I’m happy to have. The unit heats up literally within a couple minutes. Incredibly convenient. I also like that the lid needs to be pressed to be shut so that you do not inadvertently spill boiling water out of the top. The side level is also convenient. To me it’s no big deal that it’s plastic.

This is a great kettle if you are looking for something to heat up and boil water quickly. It will heat up 2 Liters of water in about 2 minutes at most. It is very effective, especially when I am in a hurry to get a hot drink ready or to get water boiling for pasta etc. I highly recommend it if you are just looking to use it for water., "However, it can ONLY be used for water. If you want to use a kettle for milk or other liquids you shouldnt get this because the liquid will just burn to the bottom of the kettle."

Used every day for almost six months before it broke. Now, the lid doesn’t close, as the little plastic latch is no longer functional., *This worked well and was exactly what I wanted in terms of the price, design, and size., *An important tip for maintenance: after you have used the kettle to fill your mug up, dump the rest of the hot water into the sink. The remaining heat will help the inside become dry, and the dumping out will prevent calcium buildup (what other reviewers have incorrectly labeled as “rust”). This will make it so you do not have to clean the inside., *Apparently, you must be very gentle with the button that opens the lid, because it will fail within six months of daily use., Otherwise, I loved it.
This is so loud. Bought it for work but when it’s heating the water I literally have to shout over it to be heard by someone 3 ft away.

"Does what its intended for... boiling water. The charging base seems kind of cheap and the cord is pretty stiff. It whistles really loudly when ready, but it does turn off automatically which is handy. Nothing fancy, but functional."

"I bought this for my father who drinks tea everyday because his hamilton one broke. Its amazing and Im a fan of the sleek steel design of it. My dad likes how very little plastic it uses and how the cap is steel too unlike his hamilton one. He puts it on his computer desk for easy use. I like how the wire can be rolled onto the bottom of the electric pad if its too long, making it accident proof. Overall I would stick with this kettle and recommend it!"

"My wife loves it, I microwave my water but she doesnt like lol . So I got this for her and she loves it. I was surprised at how quick it boils water for tea and coffee. I definitely recommend or purchase it as a gift for someone else."

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW!  This heats water faster than the microwave!
reviews.reviewText: I got this to take on trips for our "Meals in Jars"..  primarily breakfasts.  Mountain House Biscuits and Gravy is a great example.  One cup of BOILING water mixed in a bowl with 3/4 cup of mix, stir it up a bit,  wrap it in a towel, and in 10 minutes breakfast is served.  The water in this kettle comes to a heavy boil in less than 4 minutes when the kettle is filled.  It just sits on the heating base and when it\s ready, it turns off.  You pick it up and pour.  No cord!  This is a great Kettle!

I’ve had this kettle for over a month now and so far so good. Absolutely no issues. It boils water very quickly, is easy to fill up, and overall a great product., I’m giving it 4 starts because the see-through window is plastic, not glass. I really wish Amazon Basics would improve on that.. so all us health nuts can stop worrying about plastic and boiling water.

This is a great little water pot.  Brings water to boiling very quickly! See thru window allows visual of water level and boiling status.  Automatic turn off is very accurate.  I really liked this little pot for boiling water.  I took it to my daughters home over the holidays and set up my own little coffee station right in my room!

We used  this kettle less than 6 weeks. First the "On " button started to malfunction needing to be held down longer and longer in order to stay down. Then after a few days I pushed down the On button and it starting smoking and stopped working.  Very scary, glad I was watching it when it happened and could unplug it before any fire started. Amazon is replacing it but I will be watching the replacement very carefully.

The only reason I didn\t give it 5 stars is because the cord is like 18" long. I need to use it at the office and all my plugs are deep under the desk so I had to get an extension cord. Other that that the kettle is perfect for the money. And boils super fast. Shuts off when boiled just as it is supposed to do. I only used it a few times so far so I don\t know if it will die on me after extensive use. Hopefully not.

"Great. Boils water in less than five minutes. It is a bit loud though... Wouldnt suggest using this where youre not supposed to, like a gas station while on a road trip. Thats why I bought this, to quickly plug it in somewhere, boil water for soup/drink, and then run away. :)", "I havent had any problems. But when I was reading the reviews before I bought this, a few people mentioned a reaction between the water and the metal inside, yes, that occurred for me as well."

reviews.reviewTitle: As basic as basic can be, but gets the job done
reviews.reviewText: "This is a very basic electric kettle, but boy does it get the job done. We have one at the office and so I bought one for home too. Its simple, easy to use, and is super basic. Put water in, push the lever down, it heats up, and stops when done. Boiled water, each and every time. Ive bought numerous electric kettles before and while they have all sorts of fancy gizmos and gadgets to them, they all do the same thing (especially for tea or hot chocolate)...boil water."

reviews.reviewTitle: Why is it so hard to find a good 100% non-plastic kettle?!
reviews.reviewText: "Ive had my plastic kettle forever and it was not a problem mechanically. I decided we were using it too much and there is too much risk so I searched for a kettle with no plastic. I only realized later once it arrived that the water window is all plastic. Also, a new realization is that this kettle gets HOT to the touch. That is not great with little kids around or adults for that matter. If I had to do it all over again, I would have bought a glass kettle :("

reviews.reviewTitle: Basic kettle at a good price
reviews.reviewText: I needed a kettle for the office, and decided to purchased this one, mainly based on price.  It is good quality, and heats fairly quickly.  I like the small size.  The only thing is that for cleaning you cannot submerge any part of the unit.  I have not had it long, so I cannot say if this will be an issue, but we have hard water here, and I think it may be.  If that is the case, filtered water may be in order.

reviews.reviewTitle: hard to clean, but heats water well.
reviews.reviewText: it heats up the water quite quickly which is nice, but i find it incredibly difficult to clean the inside on it. especially if you get some calcium build up its almost impossible to get clean.

This tea kettle is wonderful! It works very well and is super fast in heating the water. The only concern is that it is hard to get inside of it to clean the bottom. We have some hard water buildup that is staining the stainless steel on the inside. Wish we knew how to get rid of it! UPDATE: I read in another review that letting vinegar sit in the bottom of the kettle will dissolve the spots and it worked!

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this kettle---hope this one holds up!
reviews.reviewText: "I love this kettle to make my morning cup of coffee (not to mention my afternoon cup of tea). I can put in just the right amount and it boils quickly The cordless design ( the base has a cord) is very convenient. It boils quickly and looks cute on the counter. However...after a few months, my kettle suddenly stopped working! Amazon , true to its word, sent me a replacement, and this one has been going for a few months too. I really hope it lasts for a long time."

This kettle is constructed of cheap materials.  I have used daily for a few weeks and the inside looks like it is beginning to corrode.  It is emitting a chemical like odor when pouring boiling water.  The water is also exposed to the plastic water gauge.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well and boils water fast.
reviews.reviewText: "I bought this to make a quick cup of coffee in the morning for my ride to work. Ive had it about four months, use it every day, and am very satisfied. I shopped around for a few weeks but couldnt find what I was looking for. Other similar products were either too expensive or just didnt look good to me. This electric kettle was a good price and looks good. I highly recommend it."

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast, Easy to Use, but LOUD.
reviews.reviewText: "Ive only had it for a few weeks, and have only used it a few times, but man is it fast and easy to use. I love that it only takes a few minutes to heat the water, no more than 3 or 4 at most to get it to where I need it to be.", "The only downside: how loud it is. OH MAN. As a uni student who sometimes makes instant ramen for late nights or tea to help me sleep, I always end up bringing this outside so I dont bother my roommate while they try to sleep. Its a loud, high pitched whine that is extremely annoying and cant be muffled. Noise is unbearable sometimes, and I worry that itll even leak through the walls, but I rarely use it anyway so its fine for me.", TL:DR; Works amazingly, but is just very loud and noisy.

"I wish I had read more reviews before purchasing. This doesnt have a stay warm feature, and it is also not insulated, so the contents cool down quickly, and the kettle itself is hot to the touch. I have also had the lid pop open a couple times (water was at appropriate level and lid was shut) during heating. Its great for quick heating, but the lack of insulation make it dangerous and inefficient."

This electric kettle not just looks good and boils water super quickly, it is also high quality and takes little space on the kitchen counter. Given its price - it is really the best thing you can buy out there without going super fancy and spending $80 for a freaking kettle. The only downside of this kettle - it’s small size makes it hard to clean inside

I really like it butt....  if you have someone in the house that forgets to put down the lid  it will not stop heating and could start a fire  my roommate put a burn in the counter top trying to deal with it after not putting down the lid and leaving it alone.  still use it  love it  but if some one in the house has memory problems  might not be a good fit

"We use this several times a day.  We make Areopress coffees so heat up a little water at a time and dont need one of those big water heaters on our cupboard.  Its easy to clean up if it gets mineral build up in it.  We have kind of hard well water and the cold in the kitchen faucet isnt softened.  Last week I let a little vinegar set in it and it cleaned up like new.  The outside finish stays looking great also.  We bring it on trips sometimes, its so practical."

On first use this kettle gave me a sock and tripped the fuse in the house. I thought it was due to another appliance so flipped the fused back ON and tried running it again. Surely enough it tripped the fuse again. the metal exterior means it not only conducts heat which makes it hot to touch, but also it conducts electricity! No insulation barrier = terrible design.

Where has this been all my life! I don’t like tea kettles. So I’ve been boiling water in a pan over the stove. What a pain. After all, you have to have boiling water for hot tea, it’s just not the same when water is heated in the microwave. This is so super easy and it works fantastic. Many of my teas need hot water just below the boiling point. I know just when that is and my cupa tea is scrumdiddlyumptious!

"I recently went on a trip and the place I stayed had an electric kettle in my room.  It was fantastic and lead me to purchasing this one.  This one is fine, but the other one was much faster at heating up the water so I was a bit disappointed.  Im sure that one was a lot more expensive as well so Im still pretty happy with this purchase considering the price."

"Wonderful product, useful for many things. This product was suggested to me as a way to make boiling water for pasta quicker and it works like a charm. Ive also used it steam veggies in a stainless steel strainer when in a pinch. It holds a perfect amount of water. We also use it for heating water for our french press. I am amazed at how quickly it heats up, cools, and I love that it turns itself off."

Hello- I unwrap the product. Used first time to warm 2% fat milk from costco. The bottom of this kettle got burned. Due to restricted opening; I can’t easily clean. I can’t use it because it has burnt Bottom surface. I feel cheated and i wasted my $$

I bought this to replace my tea kettle. Heats water up crazy fast and super easy to use. Beware that the carafe stays pretty hot after use and needs to cool off in a safe place. Lid is not removable for cleaning but if only using water in it then not an issue.

YUP OLD DAD MESSED UP, I SHOULD HAVE GOT 2, 1 - 4 OLDEST DAUGHTER AND ON TURKEY DAY, YOUNGEST CAME AND "I WANT ONE TOO"! SO ORDER #2 HAS BEEN DELIVERED! THIS SURE IS FAST AND HOT. EVERYONE IS HAPPY TEA/COFFER/HOT CHOCOLATE AND HOT CIDER DRINKERS NOW! THIS WORKS WONDERS ON INSTANT OATMEAL TOO. GUESS WHAT IS ON EVERYONES CHRISTMAS LIST (U GOT IT(2)) ??? I SURE STURRED UP A HORNETS NEST! ;-) HAPPY HOLIDYS ALL FROM AZ!

"Looks like the picture. Its my first electric kettle. I have used it everyday since I got it. And I think where have you been all my life. It is very easy to use and heats water up really quick. Even faster than my microwave. Its just me and the hubby so the size of it is good for us. Id say it can make about 3 and 1/2 cups in a regular size mug. Overall, really like it."

reviews.reviewTitle: "Very useful and is value for money. Note that lid doesnt come off."
reviews.reviewText: Like that it heats up fast, auto shut off after boil, light indicator for when it is on, good price value., "Note that the lid doesnt come off for cleaning and you cant effectively navigate a cleaning brush inside. So cleaning recommendation is to use some sort of vinegar solution and bring water to a boil. It is a matter of personal choice but for us lid coming off would have been a great plus.", Overall very good and recommended.

"I liked this little kettle until it stopped working December 15, 2018.  I expected it to last longer.  Perhaps it was my usage.  Im a tea drinker and drink several cups a day so for those folks who need a workhorse electric kettle.  Dont buy this."

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed every cup of water that came out of this kettle tasted and smelled like chemicals
reviews.reviewText: I was so excited when this arrived , couldn’t  wait to use it, cleaned it very thorough,  ran vinegar through it twice, let it boil three times dumped it out in between boils like instructed. when I went to drink my first cup of tea I could physically taste the chemicals in it, I am positive this wasn’t the tea, I drink this blend nightly, and my water only smelt when using this kettle. It smelled like bleach and other chemicals, it was like the smell you get at a water park I am sending it back tomorrow couldn’t even drink that 1st cup

Bought this to get hot water quickly with winter fast approaching for hot tea and hot french press coffee. This electric kettle has done just that! It is super easy to clean, easy to use, and gets the water hot quickly. I would definitely recommend this product!

I purchased the product on March2019 and 2 months later stopped heating the water properly. I have to heat water twice and still does not boil water as before. I think it is a waste of money. I was very happy until now, working for only 2 months is unacceptable. I want to have a replacement or my money back.

Needed a basic kettle that will boil water quickly without using the stove. Price was fair. Water boiled quickly.  You just fill kettle with water and place onto the base, press the button, and two minutes later you have boiled water. The safety, automatic off function works well. Large handle and wide mouth opening makes it easy to use and clean.

"I was considering getting a higher-end item that had more features and larger capacity, but Im glad I didnt.  This does exactly what I need without any fuss, and does it perfectly, quickly, and with minimal energy consumption.  In a year there hasnt been a single time when I wished it had more capacity or any additional features."

reviews.reviewTitle: Much safer than a tea kettle on the stove
reviews.reviewText: I visited my daughter in Europe + they use electric kettles there .  I fell in love with her electric kettle + ordered this one immediately upon returning home.  It automatically shuts off once it hits boiling + each time you pick it up to pour. It is fast, easy to clean + refill.  I am so happy that I no longer have to wonder if I shut the stove off when I am out.

This pot is faster than my microwave, induction plate or stovetop.  When filled to  the max level it only takes 2 minutes to come to a rolling boil.  It turns off and you lift the pot, take it to wherever with no cord dragging behind.  There is no cord at the sink when you fill it with water or clean it either.  Truly a great design Amazon.  Congrats!

"AS of right now the kettle heats up fast and does make the hot {whatever} stay hot for a while.  I made me some hot cocoa and it was way too hot to drink so let it cool while I was getting ready to do some Christmas shopping and when I came back to drink it was still a bit too hot.  I didnt taste anything funky about it.  I remembered that  some reviewers  say that it had rust, I just turn my kettle  upside down to make sure that any of the condensations was out of the  pot and I dried it ( once it was  cooled of  course) . Works for now"

reviews.reviewTitle: Ideal for a quick cup of coffee or tea !
reviews.reviewText: Simple to use, fast heating, easy to clean, takes little space and looks great sitting on the counter, easy to see gauge for water level, and just what I wanted to heat water for a cup or two of coffee or tea in the evening with dinner or just relaxing., No more messing about with the kettle on the stove or heating water in the microwave risking spills or burns !  IDEAL !

I have to say all my single girlfriends use this and it works perfectly for single people. The amount of water I need and the weight I can carry to my room is just a great match for someone like me. In addition, I noticed it is faster to boil the water than other kind of kettle which is impressed. Faster boiling time is also important for single girls like us.

We use it to make tea quickly. It’s so easy and so quick to heat the water and so easy to pour. Works perfectly. We recently visited Sweden, where everyone had one in their home, and we fell in love. Definitely recommend.

I use this every single morning to make tea for me and french press coffee for my husband. It looks nice on my countertop, boils water quickly, and was a great price. It holds enough water to fill three oversized coffee cups. The only negative for me is that the top doesn’t open all the way, so it hits the faucet lid while filling. I like to immediately dump out any leftover water after filling my tea/coffee cups, and leave the lid open for a few minutes while everything steeps; the water quickly evaporates from the hot metal and leaves it clean and dry.

Bought this to boil water faster and save money/ time-, The kettle is smaller than expected but it boils water. The Kettle can get hot so be careful-, Cleaning is relatively easy- It is sturdy- It is stainless steel., The price is very economic, Overall, another value add from Amazon-, So far so good-
Very well made. It is just a pain to fill with water from my fridge because the lid doesnt come off easy. Also its hard to clean. If that plastic peace wasnt in the front this would be awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: Literally the love of my life
reviews.reviewText: "This little thing is my lifeline. My roommate and i both rely on this kettle with our dear college-student lives. Living in a dorm, we dont have much space. However this beautiful thing sits atop my dresser and makes the hot water we need for ramen, coffee, tea, and other essentials in college life. Although it is small, do not underestimate its capacity to hold large amounts of water and its ability to boil it in no time. Thank you for this godsend."

"I like the occasional cup of tea and dont want to microwave my water so I bought this. Its great! It holds more than enough water for a few cups of tea, heats up really quick, stays hot for a while and then turns itself off. It doesnt take up too much space on my counter either."

Love this thing!  Rapidly gets my water hot - Having fresh coffee out of a French press is a far better way to start the day than a watered down Keurig cup.  This has become the most used appliance in my kitchen.  Whenever I need hot water I grab it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats water quickly, good quality product.
reviews.reviewText: This pot heats water quickly. I use it for my coffee and tea for making coffee in my workshop.  I also, hard-boil eggs in it by carefully putting the eggs in and bringing to a boil and setting a timer for 10 minutes. I’ve used it everyday for a few months and it works great.

Works fine, using it 4-5 times a week., "The only suggestion Id have for a liter device is that min range should be 250-300 ml.", The only "problem" I have is I can\t drain it completely - it keeps ~1ml inside creating fogged window., But price/quality is very good.

Purchased for my mom who is 89 yrs old.  She use to make her tea in a tea kettle.  A few times she forgot the pot on the stove and burnt the bottom.  I was very concerned about her starting a fire., I bought her this teapot and was very happy with all the safety features.  This is a worry free item., Do not hesitate on this purchase....it is stylish perfect for anyone at any age.

"You dont have to unplug the unit to pour the water. This simple, inexpensive option boils water in about 3 minutes. Great for tea or oatmeal or jell-o or instant mashed potatoes. Anything that requires boiling water. Just fill the pot, hit the button. Turns off automatically when done. Been working for months with no problems."

"Amazing product for anyone to use. So easy and simple that my 12 year old uses it to make his hot cocoa.
