purchased for first year university student... perfect... I have one just like it (different brand) and I paid a few more dollars for mine... Would purchase this one again...
I bought it to use it in my office. It gets hot on the outside so needs to be super careful. Overall, good for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: "Im trying to think of a complaint, but Ive got nothing!"
reviews.reviewText: "Ive only had this kettle for a few days, so I will update this review if I have any problems with durability. But so far, I am thoroughly impressed.", "I chose to go with Amazon Basics because of the price and so that I wouldnt have to deal with two parties (Amazon & manufacturer) in the event of the kettle breaking. I feel like I definitely made the right choice. I live by myself, so the 1L volume is perfect. This kettle heats up my water extremely quickly and quietly. It also keeps the water warm for quite a while, too, so if I have already turned it off and decided I want more tea chances are the water will still be pretty hot.", "This kettle is allowing me to enjoy a cup of tea before work without having to worry about the microwave beeping or watching a pot of water boil. Im trying to think of a complaint, but Ive got nothing!"

reviews.reviewerName: Kilde: it\s like "tilde" with a K.
reviews.reviewText: And you shall be my Zippy., And I will love you dearly, Sir Zippy., This kettle is my third, and so far the fastest. I love it dearly for it keeps me in a constant supply of tea.

"Great value. Heats up quickly. Nice medium size for just 1-2 people. Water doesnt stay hot more than 30 minutes after turning off, but not a problem for me. Tried a larger one and it was just too heavy to lift."

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Product; Needs a Minor Tweak
reviews.reviewText: Pretty good product. Looks great and works great. Perfect size for our guest roomX Minus a star because the base is very, very light. The cord is stiff and short so when the weight of the pitcher is removed from the base the cord lifts the base up. Minor annoyance that could be easily fixed.

"This boils a full pitcher of water in just a couple minutes. Its just enough water to make two large mugs of tea for my husband and myself, or three smaller cups if our daughter wants hot chocolate. It saves time and I love that I dont have to turn on my hot stove top to boil water for things like oatmeal, ramen, instant coffee, etc. Very convenient."

Never had an electric kettle before, but when my old stovetop kettle was accidentally left on a burner too long I thought I would try one. We love it. It heats quickly, goes off by itself and keeps the water hot for quite a while.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very quick, easy to use and good price, a few minor reservations
reviews.reviewText: "There are a few things I really like about this teapot and a few things I dont. I work at home (writer) and I pretty much make tea all day long and I am a person of very little patience when it comes to a watched pot, so speed counts for me. This is a pretty fast kettle and it cooks in well under three minutes for me because I never fill it. I typically just make enough to fill a large mug, plus a little for the pot. So, as far as speed goes, its great. I also like the window so that I can see the water level when Im filling it (which is a feature more quick kettles have though, I think).", "There are a few minor things I dont like. For one, the lid doesnt quite fully open and with my particular sink, it gets in the way a little. No big deal. Also, I dont think the pot clicks into the base with the authority I would like. I have a few others (I forget the brands at the moment) that do have a better more secure click, but again this is probably minor since it works and its not going anywhere unless you knock it hard with your hand. Also, the kettle does get hot, so you have to be sure to grab it by the handle. I sometimes forget if it turned water on or not and typically I brush my hand against my plastic (and one double-walled) kettle to see if they feel warm or not. You probably dont want to do that with this one.", I think that price-wise I compare this with my plastic\xa0, Proctor Silex K2070YA Electric Kettle, 1-Liter, "\xa0kettles and I love them. Some people complain of a plastic taste with the Proctor Silex, but I won (no joke) five of them and have never noticed that and I am really sensitive about that stuff. In winter (here in cold Connecticut) I keep one of those Proctor Silex kettles in each of my rooms (lazy boy) and just fill them with bottle water when I want tea and theyre great. But for now Im using this amazonBasics in my my kitchen as the primary kettle and it works find--fast and efficient. For the price, a great deal."
Good size but i disappointed for the quality, it’s not stainless steel. see the pictures.

reviews.reviewTitle: NICE HOT WATER POT.  IS IT SAFE?
reviews.reviewText: "Maybe its just me, but I really feel that water heated in a microwave oven just doesnt stay as hot as or as long as water heated with electricity,  I admit, I havent tested this theory.  It just seems that way to me.  So. Ive been excited to try this hot pot.", "It does, indeed, heat water in about 7 minutes and I have loved using it for that reason, but after reading some of the other reviews posted here about meltdowns and malfunctions, Im a little afraid to keep using it.  So Ive gone back to my stainless whistling tea kettle to make hot water for tea.  It may take a little longer, but I absolutely know it is safe.", "I want to be clear here:  Nothing has happened to make me believe it will malfunction.  But I have three cats who depend on me to keep them safe in our home.  Im giving this product three stars because it works fine so far, but Im subtracting two stars because Im worried enough about our safety to go back to using my stove top tea kettle."

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks nice, compact yet mine shuts off before fully heated sometimes.
reviews.reviewText: I really love the compact brushed stainless steel body on this kettle. Looks great if you need to leave it out. I use a kettle to heat my water quickly for more than just teas. The kettle itself is cordless and the heat plate plugs into the wall. A small light comes on inside the see through switch that tells you the kettle is heating. Auto shut off. Pour spout has a removable filter. I have been using this for over a month, and sadly I think I have a lemon because I have to baby sit this kettle because it shuts itself off to early half the time and the water is luke warm.  I tried to figure out what causes this, I though it wasn’t contacting the base or the base was bent or I needed to turn it. Or needed to fill it more. I just don’t know. I see from other reviews they like theirs and if mine worked efficiently I would love mine too. I like that it has a small footprint and looks good enough to leave out. I will keep an eye on them and if they go on sale I would try another. But for now I am going back to my Ovente that is similar yet big and tan, yet it works every time.
"The outside of the kettle gets really really hot. Ive owned many electric kettles in my life and this is the only one that Ive ever had that doesnt have good insulation. Poor design."

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for quick tea without running up power bill!
reviews.reviewText: I am constantly brewing tea and the only way for me to make it in the past was to boil a pot of water then throw in the tea bags. That, was, in turn, poured into a pitcher. This was done almost daily. As you can imagine our power bill took a beating for this., Not anymore! With this wonderful pot, I can quickly crank out tea in smaller batches and my power consumption has gone dramatically lower! This has been a great addition to our kitchen appliances as not only can I use smaller batches, keeping my tea fresher, but using fewer resources to do so!, Works perfectly, and creates delicious water for my tea! If you are having issues with flavor, consider using a faucet filter or bottled water. Sometimes the chemicals added in treated water can become nasty when cooked., This has some really great features, such as the lid staying up/open when you push the button to open the top (perfect for closing tea bags inside lid), and the automatic shut off ROCKS!, Best of all, the filter on the spout makes it perfect for using bulk (loose) tea leaves., I also love the fact that it is virtually smudge-free! Just wipe and go!, Hope this helps!

I purchased this kettle a few months ago and have been using it twice a day, each time to boil approximately 500 cc of water (the minimum amount that the instructions say you should boil with this kettle). I use water that has been run through a household water softener and dispensed from a pitcher with a Brita filter cartridge., "The 500 cc of water comes to a boil quickly, usually in about 90 seconds. Unfortunately, the boiled water always has a faint metallic taste, and the inside bottom surface of the kettle is now covered with grayish spots that, at first glance, look like mineral deposits, but cant be removed after a mild scrub with either dishwashing detergent or vinegar. Corrosion, perhaps?"

reviews.reviewTitle: Good looking to set on the table
reviews.reviewText: I like that I can take the kettle off the cradle and set it on the table; the cord will stay behind and you can just use the kettle, good looking, it goes well with anything around it.  Also, the lid is attached to the kettle and I just press a button to open it; no more missing lids.  The pour has a filter mesh, but I do not recommend using it for other than water because since the lid is attached, you would need to use a brush to clean the inside; the lid doe not come off completely.  I really like, ordered to boil water quickly and works very well, the automatic shut off is a plus for me.

"The kettle is great. It bowls quickly and the water is hot and ready. Holds a good amount of water too. My issue is that it started to rust on the inside after only 1 use. I dont leave water inside, its just my daughter and myself so no need to boil a lot of water. Dont waste your money, youll be buying a new one sooner than you think."

reviews.reviewTitle: Kettle furring after first use, boils in plastic, slower than competitors
reviews.reviewText: Literally after the first use, kettle furring started building up (see picture). I have another 1-liter Hamilton Beach kettle that only gets this amount of furring after months of use. The steel must be really low quality. Also, the water window is plastic and the water is in contact with it, so it’s just pointless to have a steel kettle if the water’s going to be boiling in plastic anyway. My Hamilton Beach also takes 2.5 minutes boiling while this one took over 3 minutes. It’s just a really bad product.

"The AmazonBasics Stainless Steel Electric Kettle is about half the size of the one I have used for years. It is 1 liter in size. What I have found through the years is that I seldom fill up my electric tea pot anyway. Im usually only filling it half or even a quarter full. With that in mind I find that the smaller size of the AmazonBasics is not a negative.", "Ive always gravitated toward the stainless steel rather than the plastic interior present in some kettles. It seems that the stainless would be healthier when bringing water to a boil. This is a stainless interior though it does have a plastic viewing window on the side. I had a similar unit once that developed a leak at the window. I havent had this unit long enough to know the longevity of the kettle.", The AmazonBasics heats up very quickly. I have found it handier and quicker than using a microwave to heat water. This seems like a good unit, very simple, which I prefer, and quick.,  One quirk that I noticed is that the top lid does not open completely by pushing the button. It opens about 2/3 of the way and then if you want it all of the way open, you must push it from there. For filling under the faucet, it is better to have it entirely open, but this is not a strong negative.

It is really simple to use so I can get my water started, chase my toddler and have hot water for tea by the time I make it back to the kettle.  It has a nice base it sits on so I can easily relocated just the kettle part once the water is hot.  I like that it is simple and straight forward so it did not have a learning curve.  It is easy to clean, though as we only heat water in it I just descale every once in a while.  I love the auto shut off.  I tend to get distracted by my toddler and let water boil longer than intended so this allows me to chase my toddler stress free and still make hot water.

Compact, easy for storage and stainless steel. What I love about this teakettle is the auto shut-off feature, and boil dry protection. It’s modern and protects the home in case – you forget. Doesn’t need to take up space on your counter, but, it can if you’d like. Water level is clearly identifiable, and, you can easily use this for more than tea, for example: soup, hot chocolate, etc. It’s awesome!

The only detractor I have with the electric kettle is the connecting base seems a tad flimsy, other than that I like the look of the kettle and it boiled about a third of its capacity in about two minutes. The switch is nice and big, lights up and flips itself off after the water has boiled. What more do you need from an electric kettle?, "Full disclosure this was a sample/review item, had it not been I probably would still have bought it or more likely its smaller capacity cousin. How often will I need to boil 1.7 liters?"

I love this kettle.  I took it to work so I can easily make some tea or coffee during the day when I need a little pick me up.  One of my fifth grade classes used it for a science experiment when they needed to heat alot of water really fast.  I also used it when I needed to heat alot of water really fast for “mindfulness jars” with a class.  It heats the water superfast.  Did I mention that it heats water quickly?!  For home or work, unless a massive amount of heated water is needed all at once, this kettle is perfect.  I can imagine that it would have been great back in my college days of eating Ramen for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  It’s svelte and efficient.  Perfect.

This sleek kettle has clean lines and many nice features. I appreciate the window that let you see the water level. There is a removable, washable filter in the spout. the handle stays cool although the kettle itself gets hot. the push button depresses to open the cover. It pours smoothly without dribbling and is fairly lightweight and easy to handle. As promised it heats in seven minutes. Best of all it has the all-important auto-off feature. Works well, looks good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud, Slow - As usual, you get what you pay for.
reviews.reviewText: "Does it boil water? Yeah, itll get the job done, but this kettle is loud AF and pretty slow.", "Wouldnt expect noise to be a problem in a house with multiple rooms I guess but if you can afford a house in 2019 then you could probably afford a better kettle so I speak for those in a dorm or studio as this thing will in fact wake up any roommates or partners.", Speed felt okay in the beginning but now it feels like its boiling slower., "Also, you cant actually remove the lid so cleaning this thing is actually a pain in the ass."

"I broke the filter piece by accident while trying to remove it one time to clean, not really necessary to have. Heats up water very quickly and automatically shuts off. Addicted to using it. Great for making anything requiring hot water. I primarily use it for hot/iced. Could be used to make Ramen if youre in college or too lazy to wait for water to boil. A little difficult to clean in my sink."

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast Boiled and Keep warm over 2 hours
reviews.reviewText: "I bought it to make the hot water and tea for family . After I received it last night ,I couldnt to wait to try it.  First of all, I was trying to boil and clean it( Boil water could to kill more of virus)  ,only took 4 mins . Then ,I left on the table over 2 hours ,the water is still warm . :)  the bottom has the special design as the wire could to round it in case the wire is too long or wants to storage it . Good Product !"

This kettle is perfect for a college apartment or a person looking to only heat water for 2-3 mugs at a time. It is very small and fits nicely on a countertop. The water heats in 1-2 minutes and stays hot for a long time after. My only complaint is that the small filter is very hard to reattach. Would recommend for people living on their own or with a few roommates!

Received this as a gift.  Love it and hate it too!  Because removing and cleaning the filter is not as easy as is described in manual (p.8.).  For me it is almost impossible remove that tiny filter from either outside or inside of the kettle.  Thinking to return it or use it and may be buy a new one after few months?  Not sure yet., -Highly disappointed and frustrated customer

Beautiful and efficient. This Stainless Steel Electric Kettle sits on a heating pad that plugs into the wall. In just seven minutes (for a full pot of water) it heats as required. I can leave it out on the counter and it fits in the décor of all the other stainless steel appliances in the kitchen.

I got a new job that didn\t have a "hot water filter" option, my boyfriend bought this teakettle for my desk and it is wonderful. Takes less than a minute to bring cold water to a full boil. The automatic turn off switch is so safe for the office. The see-through window is great too. I\m extremely happy with this item!!!

This has been a dependable kettle for heating up hot water for my coffee, tea and to cook my oatmeal. I have used this every day for the past few months and works like it should. Pours without dripping, cleans easily and nice looking too. Perfect!

This item is pretty good for the price. I purchsed 2 for a business event I was having and they both qorked great. They are very light weight and easy to use. I clean by pouring a little white vinegar in the bottom and turning it on. Then do a cycle of water after. It was smaller then I thought it would be though.

"Bought this for Christmas. If you need to bring your water to a very specific temperature because youre some sort of coffee snob, then this isnt the kettle for you. If you just want water-comma-hot for tea or oatmeal or French press, you sure can beat the price. And its cute. And it cleans up nicely."

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job but weird dots forming
reviews.reviewText: "I bought this back in January of this year, and have used it multiple times for water. However, I noticed dots starting to form on the bottom of this kettle? Im not sure what it is. I tried washing it out with soap, but the lid makes it difficult to clean. It boils water fast, but Im concerned about what the things on the bottom are. Next time, Id opt for a water kettle that has a better lid to make the process easier."

reviews.reviewTitle: Insures I have boiling water for the teapot.
reviews.reviewText: "Im a patient in a SNF and getting a proper cuppa brewed can be a challenge. With this stylish and well designed kettle I am guaranteed boiling water. Makes life much easier for the nursing staff nit having to put ups with my unspoken complaints about tepid tea."

reviews.reviewTitle: I use it everyday! Love it!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this SS portable kettle. It boils water super fast. Easy to use. Shopping and packaging was awesome as well. Amazon Basics did well with this one! Highly recommend getting one if you drink a lot of tea or hot chocolate like me.

We bought this product to make tea and hot water for other cooking (instant oatmeal, hot chocolate, etc) for when we are camping. It is very energy efficient in making hot water and it is also very quick.

I received this as a gift for Christmas and it has been used every day since. Its great to make tea, or hot cocoa. Easy to clean. I just put a bit of vinegar it and let it soak for a bit and then wash and rinse, good as new. This has been used daily for 4 months now and I have never had any problems with it. This is a great product!

It’s attractive, the handle is comfortable for my arthritic hands, the large pour spout prevents spillage from an over filled pot.  I tested it with cold water, filled the pot up, and tipped the pot over, and streamed out of the spout, and there was no leakage around the rim.  It heats up fast... I like it.

"This unassuming little electric teapot boils water faster than you can imagine.  Much faster than the stove. Easy to view fill line, the teapot shuts itself off when the water is hot, and its easy to store the cord if you want it out of the way.  Impressed at how well it functions, weve put our stove teapot away for good."

"I used the Sunbeam Hot Shot hot water heater for years.  Decided to try this for my RV and I couldnt be happier.  I like the fact that I can remove it from the base and take it to the table and it boils the water just like the Hot Shot."

"One liter water, one minute, prepare a drink. Its durable, fast and easy to clean. Im working this pot to death. Its used all day by multiple people.", "Use a brush to remove scale and its good to go."

reviews.reviewTitle: Hot water, quickly without mess or fuss
reviews.reviewText: I love this, it boils water quickly and cleanly, looks nice and I use it several times a day every day., If it wears out I will be ordering another just like it.

I just bought it one week ago and every time I turn it on, it smells like burnt plastic. Also, I do not like the fact that the lid does not open entirely and makes it hard to filling out with water. It also make a lot of noise.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quickest little kettle in the East!!
reviews.reviewText: This little kettle heats quicker than I am able to set up my coffee/filter and cup. It is lightweight, which I love! My morning coffee is a breeze.

Love this kettle. Fill with water to whichever line/volume you want. Press start lever. Presto! Heats up in a couple of minutes. It turns off automatically, which is one of the best features for me because I can burn water!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but the outside gets to hot!
reviews.reviewText: "I havent had this long, but I absolutely love it! It heats up really fast and doesnt make much noise.  I normally use it in the morning when the kids are sleeping so the noise is a big thing for me. On the other hand, I dont like how the outside gets so hot. One of the kids could burn their hand on it if they arent paying attention. Other than that, this is a great product!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Received as a gift; I love it!
reviews.reviewText: "A basic electric kettle, great for the tea lover in your life. It takes probably 3 minutes to heat up the water, and you can kind of hear it boiling, but theres a nice audible click of the switch when its ready. I found the Liter measurements a little confusing, but I quickly learned how much water to put in for one cup- theres a little window for you to see how much water is in there."

reviews.reviewText: I bought this pot because of the smaller size.  Most were too big to sit at an office desk and worked out perfect!  The down side is that it tends to be louder as it heats up.  But works well.
Simple. Easy to clean.  It takes a little more time for water boil. Apart from that, all is good .
So easy n quick. I leave this on during the day for oatmeal (instant) and tea. Very affordable.
Heats water super fast.  My kids use it to make ramen noodles  And I use it for hot chocolate.  My son is 10 and can easily use i5
In comparison with other brands, I feel this one boils my water faster :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Definately worth the money! Love it!  10 out of 10 would buy again!

He likes it cuz he drinks alot of tea and u can make more then one cup at a time with this and its faster then a microwave sonits perfect.  Really a great deal.  Perfert for tea and ramen i could this being a great product for college kids who live in dorms.  It doesnt take up much space and is super fast.  Love it.

This is a fantastic electric kettle.  Perfect for the office or home.  It has an nice auto shut off and very little plastic.  There is a small part up high - but the boiling water does not boil over it.  I highly recommend this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Super easy to use and clean when needed
reviews.reviewText: "Water heats up within minutes. It shuts itself off when its done. Super easy to use and clean when needed. I have made tea every single day now."

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely Recommend!  Awesome Product! Awesome Price!

This is a small kettle. However, it works very well and it is pleasant to the eyes., I would buy it again.

why on earth use plastic for the window to show how much water is in there?,  all my water smelled like boiled plastic. No thanks. If it was glass window, I would give it 5 stars!!!, "this is the first review ive ever left in my life, i returned this one....ordered a different one AND THAT ONE HAD A PLASTIC WINDOW TOO!!!!????  third times a charm"
This is a wedding gift on a registry.
We lime this one great to have it.
Best one yet! Perfect size
I like it and it serves the purpose. It is not the largest or the most elegant kettle you can get. But cannot complain for 18$ kettle.
"It does what its supposed to and I havent had any problems with it so far"
Works great!

"I gave this 5 stars. It does exactly what it should......heats water. The water gets very hot!!! Its great to keep at work. Small enough to tuck away.  I am planning on purchasing another one soon!!  Cant go wrong!!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little kettle good size hears water u fast without ...
reviews.reviewText: Great little kettle good size hears water u fast without having to crank up larger appliances. Very simple and enjoyable to use.

"Im not sure if I am doing something incorrectly. I started off using tap water and than moved over to distilled water...but Im getting a white residue so Im constantly wiping away on the inside. However time spent away from the stove is a plus :)"
good

This is an essential. The water goes a little beyond boiling which is hard when making tea but overall a string product. We’ve had it for three months now and use it everyday with no change in performance.
Didnt have long enough to give a true rating.
We enjoy this simple addition to home and our travels as vagabonds. Zero to boil in minutes! the best new tool in our quiver of tools.
For this price, you are getting a very nice kettle.

I love my product❤️
Love this kettle.  This kettle heated the water very rapidly.  Only problem the the lid did not open very wide.
This is my first electric kettle and I love it. It boils water a lot faster than when I used a kettle on the stovetop and stays warm for a long time.
Bought as a gift. It looks a lot more expensive then it is. Would buy for myself. User says it works great.
bought this as a gift for my dad’s house-warming and he LOVES IT. he literally uses it every day!

nice clean look, the right size for us

reviews.reviewTitle: Melted! Dangerous situation created by auto shut-off failure.
reviews.reviewText: This teapot was great for about a week of daily use.  Then my son was home alone and when he used it the automatic off feature FAILED and the button melted along with the bottom surface of the kettle.  There is a drip of melted plastic hanging off the button and the lower half of the pot is blackened with char from the melting plastic.  Not sure if it was smoking or not, but the kettle was positioned under the fridge where a few pieces of paper were hanging about a foot above it.  This was extrememly upsetting when we returned and heard the story of how the kettle melted.
Worked perfectly... until 3 days after the first use it started randomly turning on by itself and "boiling" every few hours! Even when there\s no water inside. That is super scary!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly as expected; boils a liter in ~3 minutes
reviews.reviewText: "Convenient detachable base, versatile steel design fits well with the rest of the kitchen, boils quickly enough (a full liter in about 3:15), good price. Cant go wrong!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy, no-nonsense, budget-priced, well-built electric kettle that just works!
reviews.reviewText: This AmazonBasics Electric Kettle is straight forward and easy to use.  Nothing fancy here, and that’s what makes it such a great deal!  That’s also what I find keeps me from giving t five stars.  I do wish it was a bit bigger Gerald in a couple of ways:  I wish the water window that you can see if you’ve filled it enough used larger markings and was larger for my older mother-in-law to be able to read it easier; and that it was a little larger capacity-wise, it’s tiny so it fits well on the counter; sure, but for a household in the mornings it will be on constantly.  I also wish it had an audible alert on it so that if one were to walk away you could still get alerted by sound that th kettle was finished and ready to use.  Now this isn’t a deal breaker because this little guy is plenty loud just to hear it boiling away, so again, it’s not not usable because of this.  I wish the flip lid was a “cool-touch” material because closing it after repeated use can be a hot proposition...and while I’m belly-aching about the lid, I wish it could open up wider, as it is, it is just enough to negotiate pouring fresh water into it, a bit wider would reduce mis-pourings a for the pouring challenged that could occur to us bleary eyed, early-risers...just saying!  And last but not least I do wish it would hold just-boiled water hot, rather than it cooling off so quickly.  I’m sure this would alll make the AmazonBasics Electric Kettle overly expensive, but one can wish.  And as I started out saying, the little guy works great as-is, right out of the box anyway!

"Theres no bells and whistles on this kettle but it excels at the only thing it needs to do, which is boil water quickly and safely with electricity.", "Its less than $20 so I had guarded expectations. Ive bought cheap household goods that work really well for a hot minute before disappointing, so I waited to post a review.", "Ive used this kettle for a month. Im pretty demanding of a kettle, I drink 8-10 cups of tea a day and fired up the kettle for every cup.", Let me restate that: This kettle has boiled close to 300 pots of water in one month without diminished performance, malfunctions or failure...for under $20. Not sure what more you could ask!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent kettle at this price point.  Lids opens to vertical to make filling easier.  Photo for scale.
reviews.reviewText: If you have never had an electric kettle, you will love this device.  They are indispensable  in the kitchen and excellent for dorm rooms.  The speed of boiling will be directly proportional to the wattage of the kettle for a given amount of water.  A 1.7 liter kettle is great for a family, for a dorm room you can go smaller, perhaps 1 liter like this one especially since you can actually fill it up a bit more than a liter., This kettle has the advantage over other small kettles in that the lid opens up all the way to vertical,  many of the smaller ones to not, and this makes filling them difficult.  I also like the stainless inside and the plastic window so I can see how much water is in it.  This kettle has a simple on/off which also will shut off if it boils dry (I tried it, it does)., Lower price point that another 1 liter kettle that is completely plastic,  this is a good value., If you have hard water, scale will build up on the heating plate.  Boil a cup or so of vinegar and that will clean it right up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon hit this one out of the park. Simple and elegant
reviews.reviewText: "Very impressed by the quality of all the Amazonbasics products Ive purchased. This one is no exception. Easy to use and looks great on the countertop. Made of stainless steel and there is no plastic in contact with the heating elements that I can see. 5 stars"

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont like this kettle but cant return it!
reviews.reviewText: "It is small and perfect for a single person or couple. I got it and first read the instruction booklet and followed the instruction on cleaning the kettle by boiling vinegar and water, rinse and repeat; so unlike some of the reviews here about the metallic taste upon boiling water for my first cup of tea that night and coffee the next morning - twas perfect for me! Of course its not the highest quality stainless steel but I figure for the price its ok. I think what most people refer to as rust may be calcium deposits from chlorinated tap water, but as the booklet states use white vinegar with hot water to clean that out by letting it stand....Im doing so after each use and it gets rid of the build up just like any other kettle. I cant comment on durability but hope it will last for at least a year or two. It is hot to the touch while in use and though the manufacturer though it best to keep the chord short for safety purposes its more a problem to me with such a short chord.", UPDATE....UPDATE: After my great 5 star review I must take a step back because just now I took up my kettle to use and lo and behold Rust Spots....3 of them on the inside of the kettle! What a disappointment!  My 6 time using it! Not even 6 weeks or months of use! Its taking a great risk buying here on Amazon when you live outside the US, because returning them is not worth it, as you would have to pay tax and duties both ways for it again...I was hoping to get a good kettle since it is Amazon Basics and Amazon Choice on the list in the ad! Guess that doesnt mean you cant get bad products! Another loss for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats fast, but metal housing can burn you
reviews.reviewText: "This is a cute little kettle that heats water very quickly. It will heat 0.5 litres of water to a rolling boil in about 2 minutes. I live with just my husband so this is just fine as we dont need anything large or industrial-strength. If you have a big family or kids that are prone to being rough with kitchen appliances, this might not work for you. It is made of a thin metal alloy and is not reinforced on the outside by a layer of plastic like some more expensive, heftier kettles.", This kettle is fairly easy to clean, although the lid only opens up to about 60 degrees. If it opened a full 90-degrees or wider, it would be easier to get my hand inside (and I have tiny girl hands)., "There is a screen before the spout which is not the easiest to remove or replace. Since you are only supposed to boil water in this thing, and not make your tea in it, Im not sure why the screen is necessary. It shouldnt be a problem, as I dont see myself needing to clean it very often at all.", "The cord can be wound into the base, making it take up less space. It is nice but I dont like storing electric cables that tightly as they tend to stay kinked and resist straightening and it may place strain on the wires. I used to be a sound technician so am kind of nit-picky when it comes to storage and maintenance of cords and cables.", "One thing I dont like is that you are supposed to boil at least 0.5 litres at a time. Since I often only want one cup of tea for myself, Im usually left with more hot water than I need. But all kettles probably have a minimum recommended capacity for the consideration of safety, and is not something particular to this one by AmazonBasics.", The complaints I have about this kettle are that the thin uncoated housing does get very hot. So be careful not to touch it while it’s heating, or while it contains hot liquid because you could definitely get burned. This makes this kettle not a good choice for households with small children., Because this kettle is rated at 1500 watts (same as a space heater), it can overwork your household breakers if you’ve got it plugged into the same outlet as another appliance. I had to reset the breaker for my kitchen one time because of that. Since then I’ve been cognizant of making sure I plug it into its own outlet whenever I use it., Lastly, the material on the bottom has started to discolor (see pic). It hasn’t affected flavor and does not appear to be coming off, so I don’t think it is harmful., In summary, this is just an OK kettle. It has some problems, with the potential to burn users at the top of my concerns. Despite how quickly this heats water, we mostly keep this thing stored above the fridge and rarely use it anymore.

reviews.reviewTitle: The whole thing gets way too hot
reviews.reviewText: The thing itself gets way too hot. A little plastic on the inside. Don’t buy!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little kettle.  My Keurig hates it.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this kettle to make tea and french press coffee while spending two weeks in a cabin in Yellowstone.  I figured that even if we never used it beyond our vacation, the low cost would still mean we would save money vs. what it would cost to get beverages from the Old Faithful Lodge coffee shop everyday.  The kettle was easy to use and heated water quickly. We used it every morning for fresh tea or coffee to take on walks around the geyser basin.  those were some incredible mornings. Since then I have found that we still frequently use it.  I love coffee but my stomach cannot stand the acid when coffee comes from our Keurig (or any conventional coffee maker), so I prefer french press or cold brew coffee.  Until the Amazon kettle, I boiled water on the stove or cold brewed coffee in the refrigerator overnight, but this was always time consuming, leading me to just use the Keurig for tea while my significant other used it for coffee.  Things changed when I realized that this kettle is so quick and easy to use.  I have been making french press coffee nearly everyday, and my SO has developed a taste for french press coffee as well after enjoying in on our vacation.  The Keurig is experiencing some lonely days. Poor thing.

"I have kind of weird use case for this. I already own an nice ceramic kettle that I use in my kitchen, but Im using this upstairs in my bathroom to boil water for use in a neti pot. If you dont know, a neti pot is for rinsing your sinuses, but for safety reasons the water you use needs to have been either distilled or boiled first. Putting room temperature water up your nose is really unpleasant, so I combine distilled water with a little boiled water to get a good temperature. Anyway, thats why Im boiling water away from my kitchen, and this is perfect for that. Its small enough to hang out on my bathroom counter without taking up too much space, and it works really quickly. Do be careful using it though-- dont touch the metal parts, they are hot. Ive never had an issue with that because the handle is well designed and you can easily just touch the black plastic while pouring it. So if you need a cheap easy solution to get hot water anywhere in the house, this will do it."

"I cant even begin to tell you how much I love this AmazonBasics electric kettle. My wife and I drink a lot of tea and hot chocolate and weve been shopping for an electric kettle for a while. We wanted something very simple. We didnt need any bells and whistles, and we didnt want something that was complicated to use...or too expensive. After a lot of searching on Amazon, we had almost given up on finding the perfect kettle. Then I came across this one. Its EXACTLY what we wanted and needed! Its nice looking. Its simple to use. It has the little window to see the water level. Its easy to clean. And it heats water super quickly. It even has a filter to keep any hard water scale out of your cup when pouring. (That filter, by the way, is the only thing Im not 100% happy with. Its just a little difficult to remove and reinstall, but thats a pretty minor thing.) I never in a million years thought Id find an electric kettle like this for under 18 bucks. But lo and behold, here it is. And I my wife and I couldnt be happier with it! Thank you, AmazonBasics!! (P.S. When I first ordered this kettle, the delivery time was estimated to be 4 to 5 months. But I ordered it anyway, figuring it would be worth the wait. So, I was pleasantly surprised when Amazon was able to deliver it within a couple of weeks. Yay, Amazon!!)"

I originally bought this to have at work since I am the only employee at my winery and can\t leave for coffee/tea breaks during work hours in case someone drops in for a tasting.  It has significantly increased the quality of my work days.  I drink tons of tea throughout the day and having hot water pretty much on demand is fantastic.  This little pot is very quiet, extremely quick, and makes cold water from my fridge filter piping hot in no time.  I loved this electric kettle so much that I have officially decided to ditch my stovetop one and purchased another for home.  The only "criticism" I have is that it shows fingerprints easily so if that\s something that would really bother you it\s worth noting.  For under twenty dollars?  Sold!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple, gets the job done, nice finish
reviews.reviewText: "I wanted an electric kettle for a more simple and efficient way to get hot water and pour it safely, and this unit seemed like the best option at a low cost. Since its also supported by a one year warranty, I figured it was worth a go.", My first impressions are mostly positive. You plug in the  base, set the kettle in the base, and push down on the tab (which has an amber  under the handle to fire the unit up. There are clear measurements on the semi-opaque window set in the side so you know how much you\re boiling, and after a few minutes of hissing, the water comes to an audible boil and the tab switch snaps to the "off" position. The unit pours cleanly and the handle is cool and comfortable to the touch. The rest of the unit is hot enough that it can\t be grabbed, but I can\t think of a regular kettle I would recommend touching after bringing to a boil, either., "Its a simple one touch unit with a nice brushed steel and matte black finish. It gets the job done with no fuss and is backed by a one year warranty. Unless you need a more distinctive design, go with this one."

"This thing is sleek, although too industrial-looking for my taste. But its a kitchen tool--so who cares!", "Since I have never owned, much less used, one of these before I was curious as to whether they would live up to the hype--my British friend swears by them. WOW. I filled it up and the water was boiling in less than 4 minutes. I am impressed. Since I mostly use it to make coffee in my French Press, this one is the perfect size for me.  Since I take this camping, I wanted something convenient, that wouldnt add to the hassle of packing a full kitchen. This is a nice way to have hot water for the French Press.", "My biggest gripe: the lid doesnt open a full 90 degrees to fill the container. So I am always needing to fill another container to get the filtered water into it when Im at home I use a water jug when camping.", Would definitely recommend.

"this has made making water for oatmeal, tea and coffee a super snap. When I used my other Keurig machine i had to keep filling it and making only small amounts over and over and it took forever to heat and the water was no where near as hot as this gets the water. With this little tea kettle i can make enough water for 2 bowls of instant oats and a cup of coffee or tea and easily dump some more water in it to store in the fridge for my day all in less than 5 minutes which took me over 15 minutes with my keurig machine. I plan on using this with a french press and doing my coffee that way. Also what i love that surprised me is even after the water is done boiling the bottom of the kettle isnt hot so i could take the kettle off the base and place it on my counters without them getting scald marks so thats a definite plus for me. tip to add keep away from kids as the outside gets hot!! i love the sturdy ergonomic handle which makes it easy to hold. Do not over fill it the water will blast and steam out which is a burn hazard and use this in its own socket. I used mine in the same socket my AC was in and on and my lights went out lol. so make sure it has its own universal power socket thats not being used with other high energy items like washing machines and ACs other than that its amazing."

My daughter has been trying to get me to buy one of these for years. Since I drink a cup or two of coffee in the morning, and that is pretty much all I use hot water for, I never thought I needed one., Flash forward in time., Retired, now I drink broth, tea along with coffee and use hot water a couple/few times a day., The price on this was pretty decent., "I didnt a half gallon of water heated up at once.", "Ive been using this now for awhile, and it just works.", Heats water faster than anything, as long as you want 2-4 cups (half a liter to a liter technically)., Way easier to use than the microwave even., It does get hot, but then, it is a kettle., "It is actually light weight, water has weight, so you cant count that.", It does as good as my daughter bigger fancier one does, but hers does hold about 2 liters., "I dont need 2 liters, did I mention that?", Now I sort of wish I bought this a couple years ago., UPDATE 2-JUN-2019;, We use this at least once a day, many times multiple times a day. Our water is a little (no horribly so) on the hard side, so I am showing you the deposits since I have not tried cleaning it, other than the plastic window. This is NOT a fault of the kettle, any would do the same with our tap water. The water window you can see the calcium deposits (around the edge) and I just used my finger to remove it from the actual window (came off the plastic easy)., Also a picture of the base so you can see that if you are wondering., So far the only fault is the button on top of the handle, to release the lid, is getting a little harder to press and requires more travel than when new. So other than the lid release button, it has been a champ., Still recommend this, the button is not that big an issue, at least at this point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple and suitable for light use.
reviews.reviewText: "I bought this kettle five months ago to use at the office.  I boil water for coffee in it.  It heats quickly and gets very hot on the exterior surface.  The lid doesnt open to a vertical line so it its difficult to fill from a tap or clean.  I havent seen any rust.  I use spring water with an occasional jug of distilled water, and I suppose strong ground coffee might hide any slight metallic taste.  I wouldnt try it with jasmine or green teas.", "I grew up with strontium 90 in our milk from above ground nuclear bomb tests, and unnecessary x-rays of our feet at the childrens shoe store; not  mention microwaving in plastic for years before we got the bad news on that.  So Im not intimidated by the clear plastic window on this kettle.  I keep it at the office, it works fine and it was inexpensive.  At home I have an electric kettle that doesnt cost a whole lot more, which is a clear five star choice on Amazon:  Secura SWK-1701DBO Stainless Steel Double Wall Electric Tea Kettle w/Auto Shut-Off & Boil Dry Protection Water Boiler, Black Onyx, 1.8Qt .  Pay the extra ten bucks for the orange or red.  Spoil yourself."

"Initial impressions: small, just 1 liter.  I have to be sure to fill it that far or it wont fill my french press.  It takes  4 minutes and 15 seconds to heat one liter of 60 degree F water to shutoff temp.  of 211 degrees F.  The lid doesnt open to fully vertical, I have to push it open the last 15 degrees or so.  I wish the plastic window was on the right side so my right-handed self could see it when Im holding it in my left hand and filling it by operating the cold water tap with my right hand but its easy to look inside and see how full it is so what is the window for? I guess it is to see how full it is to decide if it needs filling or the designer was left-handed.  I like the shape, the compact appearance and the handle is good, easy to hold and use through the full range of angles unlike others Ive had.  The lid closes snugly; maybe it will hold some heat and deter ants. The black plastic center of the lid works for closing it when it is hot."

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic taste from the water. It’s garbage!
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT BUY IT!! Especially you have kids!!! It’s poisonous!! I have been using it for 1 year. I usually use it for coffee or tea, so I didn’t realize the weird taste until my mom drink it directly recently!, I trusted this product because it’s amazon choice! I was wrong! I put the same water in this kettle and another one, only this one comes out the plastic taste! AND I have been giving this poison water to my little girl for half a year! OMG! I couldn’t imagine what will happen if all my family keep drinking this!, I believe the bad taste comes from the plastic or whatever material inside the kettle as I circled in the picture!  I can’t forgive myself, Why I didn’t taste the water directly, I am such a bad mom. This product is totally garbage!!!!!!!!!!!!  I’m really really angry! My little girl is only one year old, and today is her birthday, then I just found out this issue! I don’t know what to say! just don’t buy! Don’t sell this product anymore PLEASE!!!!

"I love this tea kettle, it has been my lifesaver! I love the fact that it boils water quick, so I can have black tea in the morning before class and I can have chamomile before bed to relax. Though, to boil it is noisy so I keep it in my room so I wouldnt disturb my other roommates.", "Also, I absolutely love how it boils the water enough to remove the toxins in tap water. When I cook and I have to use tap water to clean my rice, vegetables, etc, I always boil tap water first especially Lubbocks tap water that contains arsenic averaging 1.6-4 parts per billion, lead, chromium 6, disinfection-byproducts, and 12 other contaminants that cause cancer.", "Now, Im not about that life to be drinking hard water and knowing that the water contain this bad stuff that is harmful to my health.", "Before bought this tea kettle, I used a coffee marker from Walmart. It was $8. It would never boil out the bad stuff instead it formed a white ring around the bottom. I told a friend who boils the water first before using and he recommended that I get an electric tea kettle - since Amazon recommended this one. I havent gone wrong.", I love this kettle. It boils. Heats up quick. Reliable. Keeps my tea hot long. Fairly easy to clean. Removes the toxins from tap water. The best.

reviews.reviewTitle: Comes With Tea Filter For Spout!!!
reviews.reviewText: "So this was an awesome surprise! I didnt know a fine, mesh filter attachment comes for the spout. It hooks on the inside of the kettle, so its nicely hidden and still allows for a nice flow of fluid when pouring.", This is so nice that we can now use loose tea mixes without needing to buy or hassle with a tea holder!, "My only concern is that this little guy is stainless steel. I dont want to have to dry him every time, but Im afraid the kettle will rust if I dont. Also, since the kettle gets hot, it causes white mineral spots where there were water droplets on the outside from filling it.", "Lets end on another positive note, though. The handle with the button to pop open the top lid is SUPER nice. You know the odd satisfaction of a nice, clicky button? Thats how this button is, and the lid responds very nicely to the buttons command! I just wish the lid opened all the way, straight up, to be able to dry the inside of the pot easily.", It really is a lovely, little alternative to pricier kettles. It does everything that they do, yet it is a smaller capacity than the pricier ones. I think this one is the perfect size, though, really!

reviews.reviewTitle: I hate to drink the "Amazon Basics" Kool-Aid
reviews.reviewText: Man, I hate to drink the "Amazon Basics" Kool-Aid, but this is an awesome little kettle.  No more than it has to be, but perfectly functional for all that.  The water level is easy to read, the on-off is ridiculously convenient, and even the lid closure--the little black dot you can push on--does the job perfectly without getting in the way because someone tried to be too clever.  (On my previous kettle, I had to dance around steam to manage the lid closure.)  Just enough water, and a quietly small design that takes less room on the counter than previous kettles of the same volume.  I\m tempted to get two in case they stop carrying this one...
Item leaks

reviews.reviewTitle: Like a traditional stove kettle, the outer metal surfaces are too hot to touch
reviews.reviewText: "Im happy with this kettle but Ive quickly burned myself on it. My previous kettle was double walled so i could touch the outer surfaces away from the handle without it being too hot, i took this for granted. This model has no insulation or double wall so it will burn you IF you touch the metal surfaces and not the plastic handle once water is hot. If youre accustomed to outer kettle surfaces being hot then its a no brainer and no big deal. The kettle cant be put in the dishwasher and you cant wet the bottom so cleaning it is a bit of an inconvenience (first-world type) but not impossible. For the money it performs well just take care not to wet the corded base, splash water on outside of kettle  or touch exposed metal once water is boiling. It does look great!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap, small, heats fast, but do not touch the barrel unless you are ready for 1st degree burns
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is small and super easy to operate.  It heats very fast.  I have two issues with the design: its top opening is on the small side and it\s beveled.  I find tea bags stuck to the interior of the barrel all the time because it\s hard to reach into the barrel through the small lid opening if you have a fully grown hand (I\m a 5\3" female and struggling with it; I can only imagine what a 6\ man with a good-size fist would have to do to reach into the barrel).  This is a flaw that could have been easily avoided by employing a better design.  The second flaw is that the barrel is not at all insulated, so you have to be super careful not to touch it -- unless you are willing to endure 1st degree burns to your hand.  If you have young children in the house, this could be an issue.  I have another kettle at home that has a plastic barrel that insulates quite well.  I did not consider this feature when choosing this kettle, so I had to take this to work where, hopefully, no one will touch it while it\s hot.

"Ive had this for about a year now and its pretty reliable on heating up my water, but one feature makes this whole product a glaring failure in my eyes:  The outside gets WAY too hot.  If you have kids, adults with attention issues, older folks that might need to use both hands to stead the pot when pouring, or animals that jump on counters when you arent looking...all of them are at risk for getting badly burned while this kettle is in use.", "Im buying a new kettle as this gets so hot that Ive burned myself by accident just trying to reach past it for something and accidentally touching the outside.  Stainless steel may look nicer than plastic, but I should have applied more common sense that uninsulated metal gets super hot."

Attractive, compact design. The capacity is an (indicated) maximum of 1 Litre - enough for about 4 medium or 3 large cups of Tea or Coffee., The water boils fast with a window to see the level. Care is needed to grab by the handle and not touch the hot stainless steel surface after it automatically turns off., I add only filtered water, seeking to hopefully minimise or even eliminate any cleaning problems later on., "Im very pleased with this well-designed product."

"This is stainless steel. Its electric.. You plug it in and in 2 minutes your water boils... Oven gas stove heaters say goodbye.. This product kills any teapot on a gas stove.. I wake up at 4:30 every morning. I fill this product with water turn it on go to the bathroom brush my teeth , turn the water on to fill the bath . When I come out this product is turned its self off and is boiling hot.. You can then add what ever your cup of Joe is.. AmazonBasics Stainless Steel Portable Electric Hot Water Kettle - 1 Liter, Silver is a WINNER. We do not have a teapot on the stove no more.. Simply buy one then call me untruthful if Im lying.. OUTSTANDING PRODUCT....."

"This is a nearly perfect kettle.  There are no exposed heat elements inside.  The handle is very comfortable to grasp.  It is easy to guide the water as I pour. The kettle turns off when lifted. It takes about 3:30 minutes to bring a full liter to boil.  I have it connected to a smart plug so I can turn it on from the bedroom as soon as I wake. It cuts off by itself once a full boil is reached.  The only feature I would add is a thermostat. However,  if a tstat would prevent using a smart plus,  Id pass. The regular price is great,  but if you picked one up when it was discounted (which I did not),  youve got yourself a win-win."

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for a French press coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: Some reviews aren’t flattering for this kettle.  I find this kettle to be just right for my needs.  When it is filled with water it is just the right amount for the French Press that I use for my coffee.  It heats instantly and it pretty quiet.  The shut off switch makes a click sound so you know when the water is ready.  I empty any remaining water from it and open the lid to allow it to dry in between uses.  The unit is light weight and compact, and fits in a cabinet taking up minimal space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute little pot and boils quickly
reviews.reviewText: I have used this 3 times over the past couple days.  It looks cute and boils water fast.  It is convenient to just press the switch and know it will not over heat.  It is built fairly light duty, but for my usage I think it will be fine.  I am only using water in it that has come out of the refrigerator filter and after I am done, I turn it upside down in the dish drainer to minimize lime scale.  It is easy to see when it is heating because there is a red light on the "On" switch.  When the water boils, the switch pops back up and the light goes off.  The top of the kettle opens using a push button on the handle.

"I got this for my son who is attending grad school. He was using one of my spare coffee pots to heat hot water for different things. I decided on this unit after reading and viewing hundreds of heating pots. Well, it works out great for him. It takes up a lot less room, looks nice, heats up fast, and his life just seems a lot less complicated with a smart hot water heating pot like this one because he han pick it up and take it anywhere, hes not chained to the wall with a cord. when hes done he dumps out any unused water and leaves the top open to air dry and so far since August to December not one issue or complaint. I strongly recommend this Amazonbasics Stainless Steel Electric Kettle - 1-Liter for anyone, not just college students."

reviews.reviewTitle: "Very sad, dont want to return it cause I am ..."
reviews.reviewText: "I just used it for once and it had broke already second use. Very sad, dont want to return it cause I am back to China already. DONT BUY IT, Small and easily broken. You get what you pay for even its Amazonbasics brand"

the "minimum" is still a little too much for me, so I always dump part of it down the drain, which isn\t a big deal. I wish it had a "keep warm" feature or something like that. I kept the boiled water in there for on hour to see what the temp would be afterward and it was cold. I also think it\s kind of noisy--other reviews said it was so quiet. for me, the microwave is just as easy and more convenient for single cups of tea/coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Buy for a Simple Product
reviews.reviewText: An excellent bargain. This is a great buy for a high quality example of what it does:  Boil water., "I dropped a star because Im a traveler and it is 120 volt only and has an on/off switch that is a jutting plastic piece which could be knocked off if mishandled rather than a smoother low-profile rocker switch on the handle like most models.  Admittedly Ive had no trouble so far with the switch after a couple months of frequent packaways, though. It also shuts off automatically without an option to continue boiling to sterilize water, but that describes most all electric kettles."

"This thing is awesome! I bought this about two months ago and while its awesome for tea, luckily for me it has also been very helpful while my water heater is out. I can take showers elsewhere but for things like washing dishes or my nightly foot soak this has been a life saver! Its a great little teapot, easy to use and the cord can tuck nicely underneath while not in use. Do not go over the max line though! My husband almost made that mistake, but I previously read through reviews of people who had and I know my husband well enough to know he wouldnt notice the max line. So I was able to stop him in time before it boiled over. :)"

"I brought this kettle on some of my snowboarding trips this past season and its worked out great.  Water boils pretty quickly.", A few minor complaints though:, "1.  The lid doesnt lift back/high enough so it can get difficult to fill the pot with water", "2.  Also be because of the lid issue, its hard to clean.", "3.  The stainless steel can burn you if youre not careful.  Would like to see some insulating strip at least along the body of the kettle.", Minor complaints so not a deal breaker.  Good kettle and the small size is great to take along on trips.

I have been microwaving my water for hot tea for years, knowing full well I am running the risk of severely burning myself by either the measuring cup breaking or just spilling it as I try to get it out of the microwave.  This electric kettle heats water up almost twice as fast as the microwave (for the amount of water I usually heat - appx. 2 cups.)  My only concern is that the bottom of the inside of the kettle is already getting some spots - I have only used it about 10 times so far, and the spots showed up by the 2nd or 3rd use.  Hoping it will last a long time, because I really do love this kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: I never knew I needed an electric kettle
reviews.reviewText: This is a transformational piece of kitchen equipment.  Not as big as a microwave but big.  If you like tea and you have to put the water in the microwave or boil it on the stove, it takes a long time., This is really easy: fill, push the lever, 1 minute later hot water., Love it!, I have found other uses for hot water - like those pots that have really stuck on grease?  1 minute later - hot water and soap., "I know there are other uses I am not thinking of right now; bit I just got it and I havent fully explored all the uses.  Just know in 1 minute you have it."

I was kinda wary about buying this as one person said theirs only made it a month before breaking and I make tea several times a day. BUT! It is still going at 6 weeks..I am impressed by this little pot. it heats up quickly and shuts off but water still stays warm quite awhile. it cleans up fine. The spout filter is a pain to remove with my RA but other than that i would recommend it..Now if the thing breaks i will be back on to throw a rant..

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing.  My favorite Amazon Basics product.
reviews.reviewText: I almost went with a high end one of these as my "titanium tea" (credit Tim Ferris) is part of my daily routine.  I got tired of boiling water conventionally or using my coffee maker to make a cup of hot water., This then has boiled about 1,000 pots and is showing zero signs of wear.  Super fast (especially 1/2 full) and simple.  I put in the water and by the time I have my tea concoction prepped its boiling.

reviews.reviewTitle: #1 most used item at home TEA TIME ANY TIME!
reviews.reviewText: "I have this in my room, its really that convenient! Its small so it doesnt take up too much space on the table and it boils water very fast.. it automatically detects the temperature and knows when the water is boiling so you can pour whatever amount and it will do the work. I bought it because I got tired of going to the kitchen every time to get hot water.. this was a very quick and easy solution! Plus, its made mostly of stainless steel so I dont have to worry too much about the plastic toxicity (although the water window measurement is plastic, it does state the unit is BPA free)."

Purchased this for work and LOVE it. Heats up in less than 4 minutes when filled to max line. Safety shut off and stainless steel. Base is sturdy and the pot sits well on it. I have had no issues with rust. I always empty at the end of the day and leave the lid open to allow the pot to dry. We have hard water, so I try to put some white vinegar in and let it sit then rinse on a regular basis. Big enough that I can heat 3 cups worth of water during my workday when filled. Not so huge that it wastes water or takes longer to heat.

"Nice-looking, works well and is faster to boil than the Chefman electric kettle I already have. But its very loud, especially when theres only a small amount of water in the pot. I will probably keep it, but I wish it was quieter like my older kettle. Some have commented that the lid doesnt open wide but although thats true, I dont find it an issue."

"This is a no frills electric kettle. It works just fine- just some points that made me give it three stars. It doesnt seem that the stainless steel is super thick, so the water tends to cool down faster than most of the other electric kettles that Ive owned. Also the top part is hinged which makes it difficult to clean and easier to break via the mechanism that gets it to pop open. Its nice and compact and I use it when I travel, so for the price and the size, Im a happy camper, but for everyday use, the quality is just so-so in my opinion."

"After experiencing the fast boil achieved on British electric pots, I was very happy to find this kettle matched them. It is easy to pour as the side handle is much better than the over-the-top handle of my previous stove top kettle. In fact, out of habit I put this kettle on the stove top, and when I smelled the plastic burning, yanked it off and into the sink which was happily filled with water.  Then I trimmed the little plastic shards off and, voila!, it worked perfectly. Thats what I call well made!"

"Weve used this electric kettle for almost a year now and we still LOVE it!  It is fast and economical We used a watt-meter and it heats our tea water for less than the microwave AND its at a rolling boil.  We use ONLY RO water in it, so I have never had to clean the inside of the kettle. I only need to wipe off the outside.  It is still spotless inside!  (I guess that is a thumbs up to reverse osmosis water dispensers!) We would buy this again in a heartbeat."

reviews.reviewTitle: Four minutes to boil a liter of water
reviews.reviewText: This thing works great.  It takes four minutes to boil a liter or water (the capacity of the kettle) and two minutes for half a liter, which is enough for two cups of tea., "Ive used electric kettles before, mostly while living in the UK where the power is 240V.  Ive never had a kettle that worked well enough with US 120V power to be worth it.  This one absolutely does.", Getting the spout filter in and out for cleaning is a little fiddly, but not that big a deal.

"I had no idea when I got this that I would start using it every single day!  I use it for making tea and coffee, but also for heating water for pasta or heating water to deep clean things.  Its so much faster and energy efficient, not to mention water conservative, than waiting for water to run through the pipes to heat up.  I even take it with me when I travel and put the hotel coffee pot away (yuck!).  Highly recommend this to anyone and would probably gift to others."

"I dont know why I didnt buy this a long time ago!  My usual routine is to put the teapot on the stove and go about my morning, waiting a long time for hot water and/or running to shut it off before the whistle drives everyone nuts.  This unit is quick! 3 1/2 minutes to heat a full pot to boiling and I can leave it sit until Im ready to make my tea. Great value for the price. Note that its small, only on liter so be sure you are buying the size that works best for you."

"I love how fast this kettle is. I can put water on and by the time I measure out my tea and get it prepared in my steeping basket the water is ready! I have learned that the water does get EXTREMELY hot very quickly so be careful! I try and shut it off before it gets done so I dont have to wait so long before I can enjoy my tea. Easy to use, easy to clean and easy to take along on trips. I would recommend for anyone who wants a quick no fuss kettle."
Nasty quality stainless that retains some magnetism. Gnarly plastic window that is of unknown composition. Too sketchy for me to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its small, not easy to get water into and difficutl to clean bc lid doesnt open very far
reviews.reviewText: "I dont completely hate this kettle but it doesnt hold much, the lid doesnt come off nor does it open all the way up so pouring water into it is tricky, cleaning it is very difficult and its ugly, like a camp pot.  I had wanted stainless to add to the aesthetic of my kitchen but this does not.  I use it every day bc technically it works and I guess for the price its fine.  Just not well made and again, ugly."

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick to rust even from brand new box
reviews.reviewText: "I actually bought two of this.  I returned one because it was too small for my needs.  I thought, I was buying a larger capacity version.  The other, I sent it to my mom as a gift.  She reported that after a weeks use of it started to show signs of rust.  Its disappointing because its supposedly stainless steel.  Some reviewers reported similar rusting issues so I shouldve listened.  Its a waste of $20.  Dont buy."

reviews.reviewTitle: Smaller and lighter than most kettles!
reviews.reviewText: "This kettle does everything we need it to do.... sleek design, water level indicator, easy on/off switch, button at the top to open the lid... I love this machine.  And since it holds just 1 liter (not the typical 1.7), its much lighter to fill and pour.  Im 62 and am thrilled to find a kettle that is lighter weight.  Would absolutely buy this again!"

"Bought this to replace our stove one that we had to toss out. Electric kettles are the way to go. It matches my other stainless steel appliances and its too big or bulky. Looks great on the counter. Perfect for the cups of tea on the dreary English days. Quick and convenient. Downside, it does get super hot on the outside so be careful not to accidentally brush it when you put it back on the base... it burns..."

reviews.reviewTitle: Just right for retired couple and easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: "We are very pleased with this kettle.  We usually dont need more than 2 cups of hot water for tea and this fills the bill.", It is streamlined and good looking, easy to hold right hand or left and boils quickly.  This is a great buy for people who do not need more than 3 or 4 cups at a time.  Thanks Amazon!

"This pot was at an Airbnb. I used it constantly while there and when I got home I immediately got onto Amazon and purchased it. I love that the water boils quickly and as soon as it reaches the boiling point the pot shuts off. Ive had it now for over 2 weeks. I use it many times a day for my pour-overs and teas and I absolutely am in love with it! Excellent price and just the right size."

reviews.reviewTitle: Almost perfect- lid does not open all the way?
reviews.reviewText: Works fast and well, and great pricing. . . But, the lid could be better. It doesn’t open all the way. This makes it difficult to fill, and difficult to clean. The lid only opens to about 45 degrees rather than 90 (that pic with the partially open lid is all the way open!) Why? Maybe in the new model they could fix it?

"This is my first electric kettle that I purchased specifically for work. Keeping in mind that it is the cheaper route so there are no bells and whistles, it boils water just as it should and it takes just a few minutes. The only things to be weary about are that it is quite loud, it does not insulate well so once the water is hot you should only grab it by the handle, and the lid has a limited range so it doesnt open all the way which can make it awkward for cleaning."

"We used this electric kettle no more than five times and it stopped working, I mean after 5 pots of water it stopped working.  We only used it about once a month, and it just broke.  Very disappointing, buy a more expensive better one, dont buy this one."

"Ive only had this a couple of days, but Im really impressed with this little kettle. I like that it is a small capacity and boils a full liter in about 4 minutes which is less than half the time of my stove-top kettle. I also like that it has a small footprint on my crowded counter. I have 2 or 3 cups of tea everyday so this will be getting a workout. Will see how durable it is. However, Amazon products are usually good quality and you really cant beat the price."

Better quality for the price than I thought. I used my old one for over 2 years. It just broke without any signal and had to replace it. Compared a few brand and price and decided to get this one. It is stainless all around and the size fits my need. The only concern I had was the open part as it seems so small. But when I received it, it does work well and the small open part is not a big issue. No complaints for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic window inside is deteriorating after a few months.
reviews.reviewText: "Everything else about it was fine but not rotting pieces of plastic continuously from the level window. Would not recommend as it cant be healthy having those yellowing bits of plastic in water."

reviews.reviewTitle: *update* well one of two did rust badly after just two weeks...
reviews.reviewText: "Smaller than other 1.7L kettles and fits me perfectly to boil water for tea, coffee, and instant noodles. Most importantly it doesnt rust like the other brands in this price range. Bought an extra one for office. Makes some noise but not too bad. Others may be just paranoid. Overall love it.", *update* well one of two did rust badly after just two weeks... Will see how long the other one last...

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast, easy to use and reliable
reviews.reviewText: This electric Amazon Basics kettle is a champ. It boils water in less than 3 minutes. It’s easy to use and consistently reliable. I was leaning towards a similar name brand that costs twice as much. I’m glad I gave this one a chance. Be sure to look at the capacity to make sure it meets your needs since this one is smaller than other ones. It’s perfect for the two of us.

"I really love this thing!  Perfect for a single or couple.  Small enough so it doesnt take much counter space.  After a year of use its still performs as new.  One caveat, the outside gets extremely hot!  Keep plastic bowls, chip bags, etc. away from it.  Also keep hands on the handle and dont release lid and pull it open while hot.  I would use caution if I had children in the house.  Keep it and cord back out of reach."

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic comes in contact with boiling water
reviews.reviewText: Good compact size for tight areas or portability. Only complaint is that the clear portion to see water amount is plastic. The plastic does come in contact with the boiling water. I’ll be giving this away and buying an aluminum one that has no plastic contact with water.

Great option for budget kettle. Does everything needed for a kettle. Not really a big deal, but the outside kettle will obviously be hot after process. The handle is easy to use. Simple button to open lid so as no hot touch is needed. Cleaning/rinsing is simple, but would be easier if the lid went back past 90 degrees. As a budget kettle, there is no attached thermometer. As soon as is boils it stops.

Finally, a teapot that works.  I have long envied the British teapots and now I have one that works on the US electrical system.  Heats rapidly and contains more than enough water for several cups of tea.

"This device heats water faster than the previous electric kettle I had. The cordless feature is very nice. My only complaint is the lid doesnt open as wide as I would like, which slows the filling process."

I just received this yesterday and it’s awesome. It bought it for my deployment that I’m on and well aware that it needs 110v. After living overseas for a number of years you get good at checking all your appliances. Well I hooked it up to my step down and it only takes a few minutes for the water to boil. Works great with my 1L French press. Also the auto shutoff works great. Also can’t beat the price and it’s built well.

I was mostly happy with my purchase initially. I have been using this product fairly regularly (4-5 nights per week) for tea before bedtime, but in the last couple of weeks, the lid has stopped snapping shut. I was able to fix it the first two times it happened, but I have resorted to boiling water with the lid partially open the last couple of nights due to it no longer functioning., I ultimately only owned and used this for about two months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Need hot water? It does the job!
reviews.reviewText: "I bought this electric kettle because I needed hot water for tea. For that purpose, it does the job and it does it well. I originally bought it for that but then I started using it for other things as well like instant noodles for days I dont want to cook and for starting water at a boil for soups. I can also add the boiling water to a pot on a stove for faster cooking like boiled eggs. I recommend this kettle."

"The lid is weird, and the one I received doesnt open like others Ive seen in pictures. Cant get my hand in there too really clean it, but I have big hands. For the price, a great buy though. It does get very hot since its not insulated, but safe to grab by the handle. Ive used it once a day at least for tea, with no issues."

Perfect, simple kettle. Nothing more, nothing less. Just press the button and it shuts off automatically. I live at altitude and the water seems to be very much past the boiling point before shutoff, so I think the thermostat is set to 100 C. I took a star off because the kettle in the original shipment had three dents and dust.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as fast as hoped but I like it.
reviews.reviewText: "I used this to heat water daily for my french pressed coffee and my wifes tea. I love that I can lift it up and there is no attached cord. Also, it is faster and easier than both microwaving water or using a teakettle on the stovetop, but I am fairly certain that we have used faster water heaters in the past. It feels sturdy, but then again I have not owned it long nor have I dropped it accidentally either. I can not get my hand down inside of it so will have to clean with a bottle cleaner if it should come to that, but that is not a big deal as only using it to boil water, it doesnt get cleaned often.
